During the evening, over 10,000 Palestinians in the West Bank protested the current operation at the [[Kalandia|Qalandia]] border crossing, resulting in at least 2 Palestinian deaths after Al-Aqsa Brigades members opened fire on Israeli forces.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/israel-hamas-show-no-signs-of-bowing-to-pressure-for-truce/2014/07/24/90213d90-1305-11e4-8936-26932bcfd6ed_story.html|title=At least 16 killed in attack on Gaza school, sparking massive protests in West Bank|work=Washington Post | first=William|last=Booth|date=24 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://therealnews.com/t2/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=31&Itemid=74&jumival=12168|title=Al-Aqsa Brigades Open Fire on Israeli Forces at the Qalandia Checkpoint.|author=The Real News Network|publisher=}}</ref> This protest was the largest since the [[Second Intifada|second intifada]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2014/jul/25/gaza-crisis-israel-strike-un-shelter-palestinian-protesters-west-bank-live-updates|title=Gaza crisis: Kerry says ceasefire deal remains out of reach|author=Peter Walker|newspaper=the Guardian|date=2014-07-25}}</ref> Following these protests and several riots over the past few weeks, Hamas called for more, including a third [[wiktionary:Intifada|intifada]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/palestinianauthority/10990215/Israel-Gaza-conflict-Hamas-calls-for-third-intifada-after-violent-riots-in-Jerusalem-and-West-Bank.html|title=Israel-Gaza conflict: Hamas calls for 'third intifada' after violent riots in Jerusalem and West Bank|date=25 July 2014|work=Telegraph.co.uk|location=London|first=Inna|last=Lazareva}}</ref>
====25 July==== [[File:Israel Navy Strike Gaza from the Sea (14737264901).jpg|thumb|250px|An [[Israeli Navy]] patrol boat firing at targets in Gaza]] Palestinian officials have called for 25 July to be a "Day of Rage" in the West Bank and within Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/middle-east-unrest/israel-braces-day-rage-after-deadly-overnight-protests-n164666|title='Day of Rage' Protests Erupt in Jerusalem and the West Bank|author=Lawahez Jabari|work=NBC News}}</ref> In preparation of the expected protests and riots, the IDF and police have been stationed in critical points across Israel.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2014/07/25/israel-gaza-conflict/13147175/|title=Reports: 'Extremely short' cease-fire in Gaza|author=Yousef Al-Helou and Jabeen Bhatti, Special for USA TODAY|date=25 July 2014|publisher=|work=USA Today}}</ref> It was reported that 3,000–4,000 police officers would be stationed around Jerusalem.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/07/25/world/meast/mideast-crisis/|title=Deaths increase in Israel-Hamas conflict - CNN.com|date=25 July 2014|work=CNN}}</ref>
The IDF confirmed that three soldiers were killed during fighting in Gaza. One of them was killed in the course of a failed abduction attempt during which a Palestinian militant was also killed.<ref>[http://news.nana10.co.il/Article/?ArticleID=1071535 הותר לפרסום: סוכל ניסיון חטיפת חייל במרכז הרצועה<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/IDF-soldier-killed-in-central-Gaza-on-Friday-identified-as-Guy-Levy-368944|title=IDF soldier killed in central Gaza on Friday identified as Guy Levy|publisher=}}</ref> Two soldiers from the [[Nahal Brigade]] were wounded in battle and seven others were injured by a bomb when they entered a booby trapped house. During the night, the IDF announced that a division commander was injured when a wall collapsed in one of the tunnels.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/golani-division-commander-injured-in-tunnel-collapse/2014/07/25/|title=The Jewish Press » » Golani Platoon Commander Injured in Tunnel Collapse|author=Jewish Press News Briefs|work=The Jewish Press}}</ref> The IDF claimed that six Hamas fighters were killed by Israeli paratroopers. The Israeli Air Force, acting on intelligence from [[Shin Bet]], assassinated Islamic Jihad operative Salah Abu Hassanein, a member of the military council of the [[Al-Quds Brigades]] and head of Islamic Jihad's information department. His two children were also killed in the attack.<ref name="iitc2">https://www.terrorism-info.org.il//Data/articles/Art_20711/E_158_14_1902322402.pdf</ref>
Overall, the Gazan death toll rose to 867.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/Eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=716245l|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140731010710/http://www.maannews.net/Eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=716245l|dead-url=yes|archive-date=2014-07-31|title=.:: Maan News Agency ::.|publisher=}}</ref> Rockets were fired at central Israel, and communities near the Gaza border continued to come under fire. One rocket was intercepted by an Iron Dome system. One person in Israel was moderately injured by a rocket.
Hamas claimed to have killed at least 10 Israeli soldiers in fighting in Gaza on July 25.<ref name="PRESSTVJULY25">{{cite news|url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/07/25/372750/we-killed-10-more-israeli-troops-hamas/ |title=We terminated ten more Israeli soldiers: Hamas |publisher=Press TV |accessdate=25 July 2014 |date=25 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140728183855/http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/07/25/372750/we-killed-10-more-israeli-troops-hamas/ |archivedate=28 July 2014 }}</ref>
In the afternoon of 25 July, both Israel and Hamas stated that they were reviewing John Kerry's proposal, which would call for an immediate ceasefire followed by meetings in Cairo.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/middle_east/kerry-presents-gaza-cease-fire-proposal-to-israel-and-proxies-for-hamas/2014/07/25/e56775b2-13b4-11e4-9285-4243a40ddc97_story.html|title=Israel and Hamas agree to a 12-hour cease-fire|work=Washington Post | first=Sudarsan|last=Raghavan|date=25 July 2014}}</ref> Discussions would consist of:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/kerry-terms-would-see-immediate-ceasefire-followed-by-talks-in-cairo/|title=Kerry terms would see 'immediate ceasefire followed by talks in Cairo' - The Times of Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref> <br>'''Palestinian Demands''' * Opening the Gaza and Israeli border crossings, * Opening the Egypt and Gaza Rafah border crossing, * Release Shalit prisoner exchange Palestinians rearrested during Operation Brother's Keeper, * Release prisoners from the collapsed Israeli–Palestinian peace talks, * Widen the Palestinian fishing barrier, and * Establish both an airport and a seaport in Gaza<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.i24news.tv/en/news/israel/diplomacy-defense/37961-140723-liveblog-no-gaza-ceasefire-in-sight|title=LiveBlog: Hamas calls for third Intifada in West Bank|work=i24news}}</ref> Israel announced in the evening that they had rejected the ceasefire, and would not accept any ceasefire that does not include destroying the Hamas tunnels.<ref name="jpost3">{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Diplomacy-and-Politics/Report-Kerry-cautiously-optimistic-cease-fire-deal-could-be-struck-Friday-368935|title=Israel, Hamas to observe 12-hour cease-fire in Gaza|publisher=}}</ref> Israel, however, stated they would agree to a 12-hour humanitarian ceasefire in good faith.<ref name="jpost3" />
Also on 25 July, anonymous sources within the Shin Bet claimed that the war had prevented 'a catastrophic event on an apocalyptic magnitude such as the Yom Kippur war', citing evidence said to have been uncovered of a planned September attack during [[Rosh Hashanah]], in which 200 militants would have simultaneously infiltrated Israel through dozens of tunnels beneath Gaza, thousands of Hamas militants dressed in IDF fatigues would have swarmed over Israel to seize kibbutzim and murder or abduct as many Israeli citizens as possible.<ref>Aryeh Savir,[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4550733,00.html 'Hamas’ mega-attack through Gaza terror tunnels exposed,'][[Ynet]] 27 July2014.</ref> However, IDF [[Army Radio]] later quoted an unnamed "senior military official" as saying "all the tunnels were aimed at military targets and not at the Gaza-vicinity communities".<ref>[http://glz.co.il/1064-47425-he/Galatz.aspx "Can complete the destruction of tunnels within 48 hours"], ''[[Galei Tzahal]]'', 14 August 2014: "A senior military official estimated tonight (Thursday) in a conversation with Army Radio that the IDF can complete the task of destroying the tunnels within 48 hours. The military official said: 'all the tunnels were aimed at military targets and not at the Gaza-vicinity communities'..."</ref> In April 2015 intelligence sources stated that Mohammad Deif had planned such an operation, whose execution had been cancelled by the Hamas political leadership. Attempts by the Qassam Brigades nonetheless to conduct the operation during the war then failed, according to IDF assessments, because of the presence of large numbers of Israeli troops within the Strip.<ref name="ToI29April" />
====26 July==== An Israeli unit operating in [[Beit Hanoun]], Battalion 931 of the [[Nahal Brigade]], encountered a force of Hamas fighters and engaged them in a 17-minute battle, killing 15 Hamas fighters while losing 2 dead and 10 wounded.<ref>https://www.israelhayom.co.il/article/209303</ref> Another Nahal Brigade soldier was killed when an anti-tank missile struck his position in Gaza, and an Israeli Engineering Corps soldier was killed in a mortar attack on an IDF assembly zone in Israel near the Gaza border. The IDF announced that Ismail Muhammad Saad Akluk, a senior Hamas member who had been involved in Hamas' weapons development and research programs, particularly in rocket and drone production, was killed when the Israeli Air Force bombed his vehicle, acting on intelligence provided by [[Shin Bet]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Hamass-drone-and-rocket-development-chief-killed-in-IAF-strike-369048|title=Hamas's drone and rocket development chief killed in IAF strike|publisher=}}</ref>
Both Israel and Hamas agreed to a 12-hour humanitarian ceasefire from 08:00 to 20:00.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/07/26/world/meast/mideast-crisis/|title=Israel OKs cease-fire extension in Gaza; Hamas rejects - CNN.com|date=26 July 2014|work=CNN}}</ref> Although they stated that no shots would be fired, the IDF announced that they would continue to demolish tunnels during the ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/israel-continue-neutralizing-tunnels-cease-fire/story?id=24711526|title=Israel Will Continue 'Neutralizing' Tunnels During Cease-Fire|work=ABC News|date=2014-07-25}}</ref> The IDF stated that by the end of the ceasefire, only 9 rockets had been shot at Israel so far on 26 July, all before the ceasefire started.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/day-19-after-israel-rejects-his-ceasefire-deal-kerry-says-pm-okays-12-hour-time-out-idf-death-toll-35/#liveblog-entry-1036297|title=IDF toll rises to 42 with 2 more deaths; Hamas breaches truce, resumes rocket fire|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
Just prior to the expiration of the 12 hour ceasefire, Israel agreed to another four-hour extension of the ceasefire.<ref name="foxnews.com">{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2014/07/26/israel-cabinet-extends-cease-fire-despite-hamas-rocket-fire/|title=Israel extends cease-fire for 24 hours despite fresh rocket fire from Gaza|work=Fox News | date=26 July 2014}}</ref> Hamas, however, rejected the extension, and began firing rockets into Israel again, though Israel did not retaliate.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cnews.canoe.ca/CNEWS/World/2014/07/26/21834271.html |title=Gaza militants fire rockets after Israel extends truce |author=Canoe inc. |work=canoe.ca |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140731010728/http://cnews.canoe.ca/CNEWS/World/2014/07/26/21834271.html |archivedate=31 July 2014 }}</ref>
The Palestinian death toll rose above 1,000 as 150 bodies were found during the ceasefire.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-28507951|title=BBC News - Israel agrees to 24-hour Gaza ceasefire|newspaper=BBC News|date=2014-07-27}}</ref> Additionally, the IDF death toll reached 42 after 2 soldiers who were previously injured died from their wounds.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/IDF-confirms-three-more-deaths-bringing-death-toll-to-40-368982|title=IDF soldier killed by mortar shell near Gaza Strip border|publisher=}}</ref> It was also determined that the Oron Shaul had been killed in action, though his body remained missing and was presumably in the hands of Hamas.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/27/world/middleeast/losing-support-from-abroad-netanyahu-finds-a-wealth-of-backing-at-home.html?_r=0 | work=The New York Times | first=Jodi | last=Rudoren | title=Amid Outcry Abroad, a Wealth of Backing in Israel for Netanyahu | date=26 July 2014}}</ref>
====27 July==== [[File:IDF Artillery Corps in Gaza (14752483091).jpg|thumb|Israeli artillery shells targets in Gaza]] The four-hour ceasefire extension ended at midnight, and, despite the continued rocket fire from Gaza, Israel agreed to an additional ceasefire throughout all of 27 July;<ref name="foxnews.com" /> however, Hamas rejected it.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/world/article/israel-extends-gaza-ceasefire-for-24-hours-hamas-rejects-terms|title=Israel extends Gaza ceasefire for 24 hours, Hamas rejects terms|publisher=}}</ref> Hamas stated that they would not agree to any ceasefire that does not include a pullout of IDF troops.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.local10.com/news/ceasefire-between-hamas-israel-starts/27159652 |accessdate=27 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808203806/http://www.local10.com/news/ceasefire-between-hamas-israel-starts/27159652 |archivedate=8 August 2014 }}</ref>
Several hours after Israel respected UN's call to continue the humanitarian ceasefire, Hamas began firing a heavy barrage of rockets which was intercepted by the Iron Dome; in response, the IDF resumed attacks on military targets in Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4550403,00.html|title=Hamas launches rockets on Israeli towns, IDF resumes strikes|work=ynet|date=27 July 2014}}</ref> Later, Hamas requested another 24-hour ceasefire via the UN, but continued firing and took responsibility for the attacks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4550611,00.html|title=Rockets fired on Israel after Hamas agrees to humanitarian truce|work=ynet|date=27 July 2014}}</ref>
As Israel continued the demolition of tunnels between Gaza and Israel, Egypt announced that they had destroyed 13 tunnels connecting Gaza to Egypt, bringing the total number of tunnels destroyed on the Egyptian border to 1,639.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=716586|title=Egypt army destroys 13 more Gaza tunnels|work=Maan News Agency}}</ref>
Israel's Health Ministry offered humanitarian aid which included medical equipment and blood donations worth millions of shekels to the Gaza Strip, but the Palestinian Authority refused to accept it.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4550862,00.html|title=Israel offered medical aid to Gazans, but the PA refused to accept it|work=ynet|date=27 July 2014}}</ref>
The IDF later announced that they had concluded their investigation into the UNRWA deaths. They stated that one mortar bomb had landed in a courtyard of the school but caused no injuries, and that the damage that caused the casualties was not caused by the IDF.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.algemeiner.com/2014/07/27/israel-says-deaths-in-unrwa-school-were-not-caused-by-idf-fire/|title=Israel Says Deaths in UNRWA School Were Not Caused by Israeli Fire - Jewish & Israel News Algemeiner.com|work=Algemeiner.com}}</ref> The UN stated that they will be conducting their own investigation as well.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/07/27/world/meast/mideast-crisis/|title=Israeli rejects blame for deaths at U.N. shelter|authors=Karl Penhaul, Steve Almasy, Ralph Ellis, Sara Sidner|date=27 July 2014|work=CNN|accessdate=12 November 2014}}</ref>
That afternoon, Israel announced for the second time in three weeks that a car bombing had been thwarted.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183394|title=Border Police Officer Tells How He Foiled Car Bomb - Defense/Security - News - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> The car contained electrically connected gas canisters, a pipe bomb, and a switch.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.607460|title=Alleged terror attack thwarted near Jerusalem|date=27 July 2014|work=Haaretz.com|last1=Levinson|first1=Chaim}}</ref>
In the evening, Barack Obama called Netanyahu and reaffirmed his support for Israel's right to defend itself against rockets and tunnels, but expressed concern about the civilian death toll in Gaza.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://online.wsj.com/articles/obama-netanyahu-discuss-gaza-situation-by-phone-1406495551|title=Obama, Netanyahu Discuss Gaza Situation by Phone|date=27 July 2014|work=WSJ|first=Amy|last=Harder}}</ref> Obama called for a disarmed and demilitarized Gaza in any ceasefire proposal.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israelgaza-conflict-what-now-for-gaza-israel-nears-moment-of-truth-in-war-with-hamas-9631788.html |title=Israel-Gaza conflict: President Obama presses Netanyahu to call ‘immediate and unconditional’ Gaza ceasefire |work=The Independent |location=London |first=Ben |last=Lynfield |date=27 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140728102709/http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israelgaza-conflict-what-now-for-gaza-israel-nears-moment-of-truth-in-war-with-hamas-9631788.html |archivedate=28 July 2014 }}</ref>
====28 July==== Despite the unified Palestinian government, Fatah spoke out during the night against Hamas and their recent arrests of Fatah members within Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/hamas-said-to-kill-over-30-suspected-collaborators-with-israel/|title=Hamas said to kill over 30 suspected collaborators with Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
At 07:00, the United Nations Security Council held an emergency meeting to issue a statement calling for both sides to have an immediate and indefinite humanitarian ceasefire.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cnn.com/2014/07/28/world/meast/mideast-crisis/|title=Gaza says children dead after camp hit - CNN.com|date=28 July 2014|work=CNN}}</ref> The statement did not mention Hamas or Israel; instead, it only referenced the conflict in Gaza and requested that Egypt mediate a permanent ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dallasnews.com/news/local-news/20140727-u.n.-security-council-agrees-on-demand-for-gaza-cease-fire.ece|title=U.N. Security Council adopts demand for Gaza cease-fire at emergency meeting|publisher=|date=2014-07-28}}</ref>
In the afternoon, there were reports of an explosion at the [[Al-Shifa Hospital]] that resulted in dozens of injuries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/middle-east-unrest/dozens-hurt-strikes-near-gazas-shifa-hospital-refugee-camp-n166571|title=Strikes Near Gaza's Shifa Hospital, Refugee Camp Kill at Least 10|author=Ayman Mohyeldin|work=NBC News}}</ref> Initial reports from Gaza stated the Israeli F-16 planes fired missiles at the hospital,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=716699|title=10 Palestinians killed as Israel bombs Gaza playground|work=Maan News Agency}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/jul/29/israel-pounds-gaza-after-netanyahu-promises-prolonged-battle|title=Gaza pounded by Israel after Netanyahu promises prolonged battle|author=Harriet Sherwood|newspaper=the Guardian|date=2014-07-29}}</ref> but Israel stated that they believed the explosion was caused when militants attempted to fire a Fajr-5 rocket at Tel Aviv and it malfunctioned and exploded.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/story/1308990/israeli-missile-hits-gaza-hospital-compound|title=Israel Blames Hamas For Gaza Children's Deaths|work=Sky News}}</ref> Hamas stated that neither they nor the PIJ had anything to do with the explosion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551335,00.html|title=Gaza officials: Israel lying about apparent rocket fire on hospital, refugee... - Israel News, Ynetnews|work=ynet|date=28 July 2014}}</ref>
In the evening, several Hamas members infiltrated Israel through a tunnel and attacked an IDF base near [[Nahal Oz]]. According to the IDF, five soldiers and at least one of the infiltrators were killed, and the rest of the infiltrators escaped.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551343,00.html|title=Four terrorists infiltrated Israel, IDF kills at least one|work=ynet|date=28 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Five-IDF-soldiers-killed-during-attempted-terror-tunnel-infiltration-369241|title=Five IDF soldiers killed during attempted terror tunnel infiltration from Gaza|publisher=}}</ref> The infiltrators attempted unsuccessfully to take an IDF soldier's body back with them.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sdjewishworld.com/2014/07/29/gaza-war-july-28-29/|title=The Gaza War: July 28-29, 2014 - San Diego Jewish World|work=San Diego Jewish World}}</ref> Hamas claimed that the infiltrators killed 10 IDF soldiers and all returned safely.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vagazette.com/news/sns-rt-us-palestinians-israel-infiltration-20140728,0,6706630.story |accessdate=28 July 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140728211626/http://www.vagazette.com/news/sns-rt-us-palestinians-israel-infiltration-20140728,0,6706630.story |archivedate=28 July 2014 }}</ref>
In a separate incident, four IDF soldiers of the [[7th Brigade (Israel)|7th Armored Brigade]] were killed by Hamas mortar fire toward Israel's Eshkol region.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clevelandjewishnews.com/news/national_world/article_7d5eb982-1682-11e4-9c21-001a4bcf887a.html|title=Four Israelis killed in mortar attack from Gaza|work=Cleveland Jewish News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551415,00.html|title=Five IDF soldiers killed in the Gaza Strip on Monday|work=ynet|date=28 July 2014}}</ref> Shortly afterward, the IDF warned via text messages and phone calls the residents of [[Jabalia]], [[Zeitoun, Gaza|Zeitoun]] and Shejaiya to evacuate their homes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183442#.U9aDZGJdXDg|title=IDF Begins Shelling All Along Northeastern Gaza|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> Soon after the warnings, Zeitoun and Jabalia came under fire by the IDF.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183442#.U9aJ3GJdXDg|title=IDF Begins Shelling All Along Northeastern Gaza|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> The IDF later extended the evacuation warnings to Beit Hanoun and [[Beit Lahia|Beit Lahiya]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=716715|title=Israel army tells all north Gaza residents to flee their homes|work=Maan News Agency}}</ref>
In Gaza, an Israeli soldier was killed when an anti-tank rocket hit the [[IDF Caterpillar D9|D9 armored bulldozer]] he was driving. The militant squad that fired the RPG then withdrew into a nearby building that was then demolished by an IDF bulldozer, killing eight militants. Two others were found alive and taken prisoner by [[Givati Brigade]] troops.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=19105|title=Israel Hayom - 10 IDF soldiers fall in battle, no cease-fire in sight <img src="http://www.israelhayom.co.il/site/upload/photos/video_icon/video_icon_24.png" style="width:15px; height:15px;" />|publisher=}}</ref>
Hamas said that its fighters managed to kill 19 Israeli soldiers on Monday alone in three separate attacks. "Ten were killed in a behind-enemy-lines operation in eastern Gaza City, six killed in mortar attack on Israeli troops in eastern Khan Younis, and two in clashes in northern Gaza Strip," the group said.<ref name="ANADOLUAGENCYJULY29">{{cite news|url=http://www.aa.com.tr/en/gaza/365969--110-israeli-troops-killed-in-gaza-war-hamas|title=110 Israeli troops killed in Gaza war: Hamas|publisher=Anadolu Agency|accessdate=29 July 2014|date=29 July 2014}}</ref>
Israel criticized John Kerry's proposed ceasefire, stating that it favors Hamas and its continuity. Furthermore, Israel informed other nations that no ceasefire deal will be accepted without the destruction of the tunnels leading from Gaza to Israel and the demilitarization of the Gaza Strip.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://time.com/3049366/israel-hamas-conflict-differences-over-calls-to-demilitarize-gaza/|title=Israel-Hamas Conflict: Differences Over Calls To Demilitarize Gaza|author=[[Ilene Prusher]] / Jerusalem|work=TIME.com|date=28 July 2014}}</ref>
===Week 4===
====29 July==== Shortly after midnight, [[France]] announced that it had agreed to transfer 8 million Euros to Gaza in aid.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/Flash.aspx/299992#.U9eYNmJdXDg|title=France to Transfer 8 Million Euros to Palestinian Authority - Latest News Briefs - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> In Israel, Guy Meroz reported that Israeli supermarket magnate Rami Levy was providing food to the families of Israeli soldiers who were killed in action.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/rami-levy-quietly-helping-families-of-the-fallen/2014/07/29/|title=Rami Levy Quietly Helping Families of the Fallen|author=Shalom Bear|work=The Jewish Press}}</ref>
Overnight, over 100 were killed in Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551835,00.html|title=Gaza official: At least 100 killed Tuesday in Gaza|work=ynet|date=29 July 2014}}</ref> Israel targeted 70 locations within Gaza, including the home of a senior political leader of Hamas, [[Ismail Haniyeh]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://forward.com/articles/203006/furious-israel-barrage-kills-dozens-after-lull-g/?|title=Furious Israel Barrage Kills Dozens After Lull — Gaza Leader Ismail Haniyeh Targeted|date=29 July 2014|work=The Jewish Daily Forward}}</ref> Additionally, Israeli forces targeted the building containing Hamas' media offices for [[Al-Aqsa TV]] and radio.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/israelgaza-conflict-heaviest-night-of-strikes-hits-hamas-leaders-house-and-tv-headquarters-9634403.html|title=Israel-Gaza conflict: Over 100 killed after heaviest night of strikes hit only power plant, Hamas leader's house and TV headquarters|work=The Independent | location=London|first=Heather|last=Saul|date=29 July 2014}}</ref> The PIJ announced that Ahmed Najam Abu Hamda, the commander of its forces in [[Rafah]], was one of 32 killed by Israel overnight.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/heavy-airstrikes-pound-gaza-after-soldiers-deaths/|title=Heavy airstrikes pound Gaza after soldiers' deaths - The Times of Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref> Fuel tanks located outside the only Gazan power plant were also struck overnight, causing massive blackouts across Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/middle-east-unrest/israel-strikes-fuel-tanks-gazas-only-power-plant-n167291|title=Israel Strikes Fuel Tanks at Gaza's Only Power Plant|author=Ayman Mohyeldin|work=NBC News}}</ref>
In [[Rafah]], Israeli [[Givati Brigade]] troops of the Sayeret Rimon commando unit who were serving as lookouts for other Israeli troops on an anti-tunnel mission were attacked by a squad of five Hamas fighters while positioned in a building. All five of the militants were killed. Four were killed by a single Israeli soldier who ignored his commander's order to take cover and returned fire, and the fifth was killed by another soldier after running to a nearby mosque.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/lone-idf-soldier-awarded-leadership-prize-for-actions-in-2014-gaza-conflict/ | title=US-born lone soldier wins leadership prize for actions in 2014 Gaza conflict}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Chief-of-staff-approves-25-citations-to-soldiers-from-Gaza-conflict-388236 | title=Chief of staff approves 25 citations to soldiers from Gaza conflict - Israel News - Jerusalem Post}}</ref>
In the early evening, a squad of five Hamas fighters infiltrated into Israel from a tunnel in the southern Gaza Strip. IDF Givati Brigade troops identified them as they emerged from the tunnel and killed all five without sustaining any casualties. A subsequent search of the tunnel shaft from which they had emerged uncovered numerous weapons.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://news.walla.co.il/item/2770446 | title=כוח גבעתי חיסל 5 מחבלים שיצאו ממנהרה בדרום הרצועה| date=2014-07-29}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551863,00.html|title=Givati forces eliminate five terrorists that exited tunnel in Gaza Strip|work=ynet|date=29 July 2014}}</ref> The militants were carrying a large amount of explosives and weapons for what the IDF believed was for a suicide mission.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/alert-idf-eyes-foil-new-tunnel-terror-infiltration-attempt/2014/07/29/|title=Alert IDF Eyes Foil New Tunnel Terror Infiltration Attempt|author=Hana Levi Julian|work=The Jewish Press}}</ref>
In the early morning, it was announced that Egypt agreed to have Hamas and PIJ representatives be part of the Palestinian delegation set to meet on 29 July in Cairo.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/2/8/107309/World/Region/Hamas,-Islamic-Jihad-officials-head-to-Cairo-for-G.aspx|title=Hamas, Islamic Jihad officials head to Cairo for Gaza talks - Region - World - Ahram Online|publisher=}}</ref> In the afternoon, the [[Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO]] said that a 3-day unilateral ceasefire would be announced shortly.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thewire.com/global/2014/07/hamas-will-reportedly-declare-three-day-truce/375219/|title=Update: Hamas Rejects Latest Ceasefire Bid, Fighting Intensifies|author=Adam Chandler|work=The Wire|date=2014-07-29}}</ref> Hamas however rejected the ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lse.co.uk/AllNews.asp?code=59robxvs&headline=Hamas_Denies_Truce_After_Deadliest_24_Hours_In_Middle_East_Fighting|title=Hamas Denies Truce After Deadliest 24 Hours In Middle East Fighting|publisher=|date=2014-07-29}}</ref> Later in the evening, it was again announced that all sides had agreed to a ceasefire, though no official word was given.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Report-Israel-and-Hamas-reach-agreement-to-end-Gaza-hostilities-369315|title=Report: Israel and Hamas reach agreement to end Gaza hostilities|publisher=}}</ref>
Waddah Abu Amer, a political leader of the [[Democratic Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] (DFLP), his wife, and five children were killed when the army fired a missile into their home in Khan Younis.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=716775 |title=Maan News article|work=Maan News Agency}}</ref>
As of 29 July 200,000 of Gaza's 1.6 million residents were seeking shelter in UNRWA schools.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551934,00.html|title=UNRWA: 200,000 Palestinians being sheltered by UN in Gaza|work=ynet|date=29 July 2014}}</ref> Additionally 1,190 Palestinians have been killed through 22 days of the conflict.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4551963,00.html|title=Over 100 deaths in Gaza bring total Palestinian deaths to over 1,190|work=ynet|date=29 July 2014}}</ref>
====30 July==== [[File:Idf-paratroopers-operate-in-gaza-operation-protective-edge.jpg|thumb|Israeli paratroopers operating in Gaza]] During the night, the PIJ stated that no Palestinian group had been formally invited to Egypt to discuss a ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4552049,00.html|title=Islamic Jihad: Palestinian envoy to Cairo still hasn't been built|work=ynet|date=30 July 2014}}</ref>
A UNRWA school was once again hit overnight resulting in 19 Palestinian deaths.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/blogs/thetwo-way/2014/07/30/336497615/gaza-conflict-shell-strikes-un-school-killing-up-to-19-who-sought-shelter|title=Gaza Conflict: Shell Strikes U.N. School, Killing Up To 19 Who Sought Shelter|date=30 July 2014|work=NPR.org}}</ref> Israel admitted that one of their rockets hit the school when they were returning fire after being shot at from the vicinity of the school.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Rockets-found-at-UNRWA-school-for-third-time-369358|title=IDF accuses Palestinians of firing from vicinity of UNRWA school, says probing deaths|publisher=}}</ref>
Israel agreed to a four-hour humanitarian ceasefire from 15:00 to 19:00, however stated that it did not apply to areas they were currently operating in, and residents were requested to not return home.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://time.com/3057517/israel-humanitarian-ceasefire-gaza-hamas/|title=Israel Announces 4-Hour Humanitarian Cease-fire|author=Mirren Gidda|work=TIME.com|date=30 July 2014}}</ref> Hamas rejected the ceasefire, calling it a media stunt by Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldbulletin.net/world/141623/israel-declares-4-hour-humanitarian-truce-in-gaza|title=Israel declares 4-hour humanitarian truce in Gaza - Middle East - Worldbulletin News|work=World Bulletin}}</ref>
The IDF announced that nine militants were killed in clashes with IDF troops throughout the day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/IDF-strikes-Gaza-power-plant-Haniyehs-home-369353|title=IDF strikes 80 Hamas and Islamic Jihad targets across Gaza, steps up offensive|publisher=}}</ref> Three IDF soldiers from the [[Maglan]] commando unit were killed and fifteen wounded after entering an explosives-rigged building near Khan Yunis that was subsequently blown up on top of them. The building, which was allegedly a UNRWA health clinic, had an entry shaft to a tunnel the soldiers were sent in to eliminate. IDF soldiers evacuating the casualties were fired on by Palestinian militants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/day-23-us-and-israel-deny-report-of-harsh-obama-netanyahu-call-rockets-fired-on-ta-confusion-over-truce/#liveblog-entry-1039316|title=Government resolves to intensify Gaza offensive, after 3 soldiers killed|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/3-idf-soldiers-killed-in-booby-trapped-unrwa-clinic/ | title=Militants 'blow up UNRWA clinic,' killing 3 soldiers}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4552444,00.html|title=Cleared for publication: Three IDF soldiers killed in Gaza Strip|work=ynet|date=30 July 2014}}</ref> UNRWA later announced that this building was not their property and they did not have a health center at this location.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/3-idf-soldiers-killed-in-booby-trapped-unrwa-clinic/|title=Militants 'blow up UNRWA clinic,' killing 3 soldiers - The Times of Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref> Hamas claimed that at least 15 Israeli soldiers were killed in this attack.<ref>[http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/07/30/373427/three-more-israeli-soldiers-die/ Three other Israeli soldiers killed in Gaza offensive] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808051119/http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/07/30/373427/three-more-israeli-soldiers-die/ |date=8 August 2014 }}</ref>
====31 July==== The US announced that they agreed to transfer a number of arms to Israel, including rocket launchers, mortar rounds, grenades and other arms.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/u-resupplies-israel-munitions-gaza-offensive-rages-205214960.html|title=U.S. resupplies Israel with munitions as Gaza offensive rages|date=30 July 2014|work=Yahoo News}}</ref> For many years, the US has stored weapons in Israel for their use, under the [[War reserve stock|War Reserves Stock]] Allies-Israel program,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/the-us-is-stockpiling-a-huge-cache-of-weapons-in-israel-2012-4|title=The US Is Stockpiling A Huge Cache Of Weapons In Israel|date=23 April 2012|work=Business Insider}}</ref> however they have agreed to transfer these to Israel for their use.
In the early morning the IDF the call-up of an additional 18,000 reservists,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishjournal.com/israel/article/focus_on_the_tunnels_kerry_tells_netanyahu|title=Focus on the tunnels, Kerry tells Netanyahu - Israel|work=Jewish Journal}}</ref> bring the total to 84,000.
Five Israeli soldiers of the [[188th Armored Brigade]] were killed in a mortar attack on their position in Israel's [[Eshkol Regional Council]], near the border with Gaza. Three other soldiers were wounded by sniper fire in Gaza. There were a number of clashes between the IDF and militants in Gaza, including one where Golani Brigade troops killed an armed Palestinian emerging from a tunnel and another where a paratrooper squad identified about five militants and called in an airstrike which killed them. A total of 15 Palestinian militants were killed. According to [[Magen David Adom]], 26 people were injured by rocket fire, most of them suffering from shock. A man was seriously injured in [[Kiryat Gat]] by shrapnel after a rocket was intercepted over the city, and two soldiers were injured by rocket fire in [[Sderot]].<ref>{{Cite news | url=https://www.haaretz.com/.premium-mortar-fire-kills-5-soldiers-in-staging-area-near-strip-1.5257713 | title=Mortar Fire Kills 5 Soldiers in Staging Area Near Strip| newspaper=Haaretz| date=August 2014| last1=Cohen| first1=Gili}}</ref><ref name="mfa" />
The Palestinian Authority announced that it plans to sue Israel in the [[International Criminal Court]] for war crimes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/pa-to-sign-rome-statute-of-international-criminal-court/|title=PA to sign Rome Statute of ICC|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref> The PA chose to join the ICC and sue Israel despite the risk of knowing it can be sued back by Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183549#.U9pNmmJdXDg|title=Despite Risks, PA Says Its Ready to Join ICC|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
Israel and Hamas agreed to a 72-hour humanitarian cease-fire set to begin on 1 August at 08:00. The United States Secretary of State, John Kerry, stated "this is a respite. It is a moment of opportunity, not an end." Furthermore, Netanyahu, stated that Israel will continue to destroy Hamas' tunnel network with or without a ceasefire. Delegates from Israel, the US, the UN, and other parties have agreed to meet in Cairo to discuss terms during the ceasefire. Hamas would be represented, though Israel and the US would not negotiate with Hamas given their terrorist classification. Egypt will be the mediator between the two allies and Hamas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/israel-vows-destroy-hamas-tunnels-24787811|title=International|author=ABC News|work=ABC News}}</ref>
The cease-fire comes after the death toll in Gaza rose to at least 1,441, surpassing the casualties of the [[Gaza War (2008–09)|Gaza War]] that occurred in late 2008 through early 2009.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/israel-vows-destroy-hamas-tunnels-24787811?page=2|title=International|author=ABC News|work=ABC News}}</ref>
====1 August==== Hours before the 72-hour ceasefire was announced, US Secretary of State John Kerry announced that "... Israel will be able to continue its defensive operations that are behind its lines, and Palestinians will be able to receive food, medicine and additional humanitarian assistance."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/video/world/middleeast/100000003033425/kerry-announces-cease-fire.html|title=Kerry Announces Cease-Fire|date=1 August 2014|work=NYTimes.com|accessdate=12 November 2014}}</ref>
Overnight 29 July–August 1, Israel and Hamas agreed to a 3-day ceasefire, to come into force at 08:00hrs. Forces were to remain in place. Israel declared it would continue search and destroy operations on tunnels within its lines: Hamas agreed not to fire over the border, but said it would not tolerate continued operations against their tunnels during the period.<ref name="BFAI">[https://blackfriday.amnesty.org/report.php 'Black Friday,'] [[Amnesty International]] 29 July 2015</ref>
Hamas fighters emerged from a tunnel in Rafah and attacked an Israeli reconnaissance unit of the Givati Brigade. A suicide bomber exploded among the soldiers while gunmen exchanged fire with them. Three Israeli soldiers were killed, including the reconnaissance unit's commander and his radio operator. Hamas fighters managed to seize the body of one of the soldiers, Second Lieutenant Hadar Goldin, before escaping. A Hamas fighter wearing an Israeli uniform was also reportedly killed in the clash. According to the IDF, the unit was attacked 90 minutes after the ceasefire came into effect.<ref>{{Cite news | url=https://www.haaretz.com/.premium-what-happened-in-rafah-on-black-friday-1.5258612 | title=What Happened in Gaza's Rafah on 'Black Friday'?| newspaper=Haaretz| date=2014-08-08| last1=Harel| first1=Amos| last2=Cohen| first2=Gili}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/army-releases-video-taken-by-soldier-killed-in-gaza/ | title=A sliver of war, as seen through the eyes of a fallen Israeli soldier}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.algemeiner.com/2014/08/01/operation-%E2%80%98protective-edge%E2%80%99-day-25-israeli-soldier-hadar-goldin-23-kidnapped-by-hamas-in-ceasefire-breach-live-updates/|title=OPERATION 'PROTECTIVE EDGE' DAY 25: Obama Condemns Abduction of IDF Soldier; Hamas Claims it Has Lost Contact With Fighters (LIVE UPDATES)|work=Algemeiner.com}}</ref><ref name="Bregman" /><ref>{{cite news|last1=Ginsburg|first1=Mitch|title=IDF searches for officer kidnapped in Rafah attack that also killed 2 soldiers|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/idf-searches-frantically-for-soldier-kidnapped-in-rafah/|accessdate=1 August 2014}}</ref> Israel adopted the [[Hannibal Directive|Hannibal Protocol]]. Colonel Ofer Winter, the commander of the Givati Brigade, on the night the ceasefire was brokered, ordered a search and destroy operation for a suspected tunnel or related infrastructure 2 km northwest of Israel's border, in an area Israel had earlier searched and then withdrawn from. At the time of the brokered ceasefire it lay beyond Israel's lines. The orders foresaw making "a big boom before the ceasefire” came into effect.<ref name="BFAI" /> At 07:30 am, Hamas's military wing tweeted that battles were taking place in east Rafah, causing casualties for the IDF. Palestinian casualties started arriving at the al-Najjar hospital by 08:00 am, and Hamas declared it had captured a Lieutenant Hadar Goldin. After 08:00 Palestinians, hearing of the ceasefire, began to return to their homes in the area.<ref name="BFAI" /> No warning was given to Rafah residents: for three hours, massive firepower was trained on the area. The IDF fired around 800 artillery shells and 260 mortar shells, while combat planes bombed about 20 targets and combat helicopters bombed another 14.<ref>{{Cite news | url=https://www.haaretz.com/.premium-black-friday-probe-use-of-firepower-was-proportionate-1.5351005 | title=Probe of Gaza Op's 'Black Friday': Soldiers Faced 'Unreasonable' Situation| newspaper=Haaretz| date=2015-04-14| last1=Cohen| first1=Gili}}</ref> By day's end, the munitions expended had reached 2,000. Bulldozers flattened houses in which people were hiding. Cars in which Palestinians tried to flee were shot at. Survivors described jets, drones, helicopters and artillery raining fire at pedestrians and vehicles, including ambulances either returning for the ceasefire or fleeing the renewed onslaught.<ref name="BFAI" /> According to Palestinian sources, about 130 Palestinians were killed and hundreds wounded.<ref name="Bregman">[https://theconversation.com/un-war-crimes-panel-must-investigate-israeli-colonel-who-brought-holy-war-to-gaza-30630 UN war crimes panel must investigate Israeli colonel who brought ‘Holy War’ to Gaza], The Conversation 18 August 2014.</ref> An IDF investigation concluded that 42 Palestinian militants and 72 civilians were killed in the bombardment.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/idf-clears-troops-in-massive-deadly-bombardment-during-2014-gaza-war/ | title=IDF clears troops in massive deadly bombardment during 2014 Gaza war}}</ref> Throughout the day,Israel kept up fire on the al-Najjar hospital and its vicinity, causing further casualties, and it had to be evacuated when the fire became too intense, at 15:30 pm.<ref name="BFAI" />
The White House Press Secretary, [[Josh Earnest]] called the capture of the IDF soldier a barbaric violation of the ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tribune.com.pk/story/742986/us-calls-hamas-attack-barbaric-violation-of-gaza-ceasefire/|title=US seeks urgent Qatari, Turkish help to free Israeli soldier|publisher=|date=August 2014}}</ref> The US [[Deputy National Security Advisor]], [[Tony Blinken]] also commented calling the capture outrageous and demanding the immediate return of the soldier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/wireStory/us-abduction-israeli-outrageous-24803679|title=Politics|author=ABC News|work=ABC News}}</ref> John Kerry called the incident outrageous and called for the immediate and unconditional release of the soldier.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/politics/article/US-Abduction-of-Israeli-would-be-outrageous-5662201.php |accessdate=1 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812061913/http://www.mysanantonio.com/news/politics/article/US-Abduction-of-Israeli-would-be-outrageous-5662201.php |archivedate=12 August 2014 }}</ref> Ban Ki-moon stated that he placed full blame for the truce violations on Hamas and ordered the immediate release of Goldin.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.startribune.com/world/269559871.html |accessdate=1 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140804003618/http://www.startribune.com/world/269559871.html |archivedate=4 August 2014 }}</ref> Canada's Foreign Affairs Minister [[John Baird (Canadian politician)|John Baird]] called the capture and breaking of the ceasefire "disgraceful and repugnant" and stated that Hamas has lost all credibility.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ctvnews.ca/politics/baird-condemns-hamas-as-ceasefire-crumbles-1.1942511|title=Gaza conflict: Canada's Foreign Affairs Minister Baird condemns Hamas as ceasefire crumbles - CTV News|work=CTVNews}}</ref> [[Turkey]] [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Turkey)|Foreign Minister]] [[Ahmet Davutoglu]] stated that although a ceasefire is the number one priority they are willing to help Israel in any way they can find Goldin.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2014/Aug-01/265794-turkey-offers-help-on-captured-israeli-says-gaza-ceasefire-priority.ashx#axzz39AXlYdBN|title=Turkey offers help on captured Israeli, says Gaza ceasefire priority|work=The Daily Star Newspaper - Lebanon}}</ref>
At around 10:00 at least 15 Hamas rockets were fired from Gaza, seven reportedly intercepted by Iron Dome.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Palestinian-report-3-killed-20-others-wounded-in-Israeli-artillery-attack-369706|title=Fighting in Gaza continues as truce collapses|publisher=}}</ref> Otherwise, Hamas did not engaged in any further combat clashes with the Israeli forces that day in Rafah. By day's end 2,201 houses were destroyed or damaged.<ref name="BFAI" />
====2 August==== At around 02:30 A.M. Hamas military wing, [[Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades|Qassam Brigades]], denied holding Hadar Goldin.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.608331|title=LIVE UPDATES: Operation Protective Edge, day 25|date=1 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref> It also acknowledged that it had lost contact soon after the firefight with group that was thought to have clashed with Goldin and the other soldiers. It presumed that Goldin and the militant squad which had taken him were all killed by Israeli airstrikes and artillery fire.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/mobile/1.608426?v=C2449B0D1814376D32BB5D7B0BE1A1A1|title=LIVE UPDATES: Operation Protective Edge, day 26|publisher=|newspaper=Haaretz|date=2014-08-03}}</ref> That morning Israeli forensic investigators concluded Goldin had died the day before. Israel continued through to 3 August to lay waste greenhouses, homes, fields and orchards, turning the outskirts of Rafah into a wasteland.<ref name="BFAI" />
According to officials within the Gaza Health Ministry, the intense bombardment in the area where Goldin was thought to have been abducted, caused at least 112 Palestinian casualties.<ref>[http://www.unitedjerusalem.org/index2.asp?id=1810033 United Jerusalem - - Week in Review - 8/2/2014<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailysabah.com/mideast/2014/08/02/gaza-death-toll-rises-to-1644|title=Gaza's death toll rises to 1712 - MidEast - Daily Sabah|work=dailysabah.com}}</ref>
====3 August==== As morning unfolded on the 27th day of the conflict, Israel targeted Gaza as air raids and tank shelling resumed in the southern and central part of Gaza. At least 13 Palestinians have been reported killed in the ongoing raids, and many are still missing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/08/03/373844/israeli-attacks-kill-13-more-palestinians/ |accessdate=3 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140806194016/http://www.presstv.ir/detail/2014/08/03/373844/israeli-attacks-kill-13-more-palestinians/ |archivedate=6 August 2014 |title=PressTV }}</ref>
At around 09:30-10:00 The Al-Zafer 9 tower, and many other buildings in central Gaza was subject to heavy Israeli fire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://live.aljazeera.com/Event/Gaza_Blog/123076852|title=Gaza Blog|work=AJE Live Events}}</ref>
Al-Aqsa TV initially reports that at around 11:00 a UN school in Rafah is under Israeli fire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://live.aljazeera.com/Event/Gaza_Blog/123077350|title=Gaza Blog|work=AJE Live Events}}</ref> Various reports, including reports from the Palestinian health ministry have reported that at least seven people were killed in the attack and more than 30 injured.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-28628682|title=BBC News - Gaza crisis: Deadly strike 'at UN school in Rafah'|newspaper=BBC News|date=2014-08-03}}</ref> Latest reports suggest that "...an explosion just outside the school gates.", were witnessed at around 10:30<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/live/2014/aug/03/gaza-conflict-un-school-israeli-airstrike-live?CMP=twt_gu#block-53ddfb7de4b0a2344ae6ef45|title=Gaza conflict: UN school struck in Rafah by Israeli air strike|author=Alexandra Topping|newspaper=the Guardian|date=2014-08-03}}</ref> Further reports suggest that "... It was not immediately clear whether the strike was the result of Israeli or Palestinian fire."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/israel-pulls-back-tanks-troops-gaza-war-24819497|title=International|author=ABC News|work=ABC News}}</ref> Israel released a statement, stating Israeli military surveillance video showed that the IDF had targeted three militants who were near the school on a motorcycle. The IDF is still investigating the incident further. The death toll in Gaza topped 1,800.<ref name="haaretz.com">{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/mobile/1.608548?v=CF95BE01F43B1FDCB832D5632E4FF41F|title=LIVE UPDATES: Operation Protective Edge, day 27|publisher=|newspaper=Haaretz|date=2014-08-04}}</ref>
It has been determined by the IDF that 2nd Lt. Hadar Goldin was killed in action, after Israel employed its "[[Hannibal Directive]]," which dictates that Israel bombard the area where the soldier was taken captive, even at the risk of the soldier, in order to ensure that he is not taken captive into enemy territory.<ref name="haaretz.com" /> Also, the IDF is reportedly finishing its destruction of the dozens of tunnels it has discovered, however Netanyahu has declared that Israel's operation in Gaza to restore security will continue, and made it clear that Israel will not negotiate ceasefires with Hamas due to the latest, of many breaches, in the ceasefires. Consequently, Israel will withdraw its forces when it deems security has been restored.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/world/middleeast/la-fg-israel-gaza-hamas-missing-soldier-20140802-story.html|title=Israel says missing soldier was killed in Gaza, not captured|date=2 August 2014|work=latimes.com|first=Batsheva|last=Sobelman}}</ref>
Ahmad al-Mabhouh, a Hamas commander who was an engineering and sabotage expert in a Hamas unit in the [[Jabaliya Camp|Jabaliya refugee camp]], was killed in an Israeli airstrike based on intelligence provided by [[Shin Bet]]. Mabhouh, who was a nephew of Hamas commander [[Mahmoud al-Mabhouh]], had participated in rocket attacks on Israel and the preparation of complex explosive charges to be used by Hamas.<ref>{{Cite news | url=https://www.ynet.co.il/articles/0,7340,L-4554340,00.html | title=חוסל אחיינו של מחמוד אל-מבחוח| newspaper=Ynet| date=2014-03-08| last1=זיתון| first1=יואב}}</ref> Four other militants were killed when the building they were positioned in was shelled by the IDF and collapsed. Givati Brigade soldiers discovered and seized quantities of weapons and munitions, and discovered the entrance to a tunnel. Three militants were spotted emerging from the tunnel, and fled under heavy IDF shelling to a nearby home. All three were killed when the home was shelled. The tunnel was subsequently destroyed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/IDF-wipes-out-remaining-known-Hamas-tunnels-in-Gaza-369953|title=IDF wipes out remaining known Hamas tunnels in Gaza|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4554346,00.html|title=IDF, Shin Bet kill nephew of senior Hamas figure Mahmoud al-Mabhouh|work=ynet|date=3 August 2014}}</ref> Palestinian militants fired at least 119 rockets at Israel throughout the day, eight of which were shot down by the Iron Dome.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4554243,00.html|title=At least 119 rockets fired at Israel on Sunday|work=ynet|date=4 August 2014}}</ref>
The IDF began redeploying ground forces, including the removal of many of their forces, however Israel Cabinet Minister, Amir Peretz, clarified, saying, "It's not a withdrawal. It's setting up a new line that is a more controlled line with the air force doing its work."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2014/08/03/israeli-begins-redeploying-along-gaza-border?page=2|title=Israel Withdraws Most Troops From Gaza - US News|work=US News & World Report}}</ref>
====4 August==== Israel declared a seven-hour humanitarian ceasefire, except for Rafah, starting from 10:00-17:00 to allow aid for civilians.<ref>{{cite news|title=Israel declares partial Gaza ceasefire but fighting goes on in Rafah|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/aug/04/israel-declares-truce-fighting-in-rafah|date=4 August 2014}}</ref> A few hours before the ceasefire was due to start, an Israeli airstrike killed senior Islamic Jihad commander Danial Mansour in northern Gaza, and rocket fire from Gaza continued to hit Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnews.go.com/International/wireStory/israel-withdraws-troops-gaza-24826484|title=International|author=ABC News|work=ABC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4554464,00.html|title=Rocket fire, attacks on Gaza amid ceasefire|work=ynet|date=4 August 2014}}</ref><ref name="iitc2" /> the IDF stated this occurred just prior to 10:00.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://online.wsj.com/articles/gaza-airstrike-kills-child-palestinian-officials-say-1407151901|title=Israel and Hamas Start 72-hour Ceasefire in Gaza - WSJ|date=5 August 2014|work=WSJ|first1=Nicholas|last1=Casey|first2=Adam|last2=Entous|first3=Joshua|last3=Mitnick}}</ref> According to news reporters, just 6 minutes after the beginning the ceasefire, an [[Air-to-surface missile|ASM]] missile was fired at a three-story house in the [[Al-Shati (camp)|Shati refugee camp]], killing a Palestinian eight-year-old girl.<ref>[http://www.france24.com/en/20140804-israel-declares-seven-hour-partial-ceasefire-gaza-strip/ Child killed, dozens injured during 7-hour Gaza ‘ceasefire’] ''[[France 24]]''</ref>
In the early afternoon, a man named Mohammad Jabbis,<ref name="haaretz.com" /> in downtown Jerusalem, driving an industrial digger, hit a pedestrian, bus, and car; before the driver was shot and killed by police.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4554671,00.html|title=Terror in Jerusalem: One killed, six hurt when terrorist goes on rampage in ... - Israel News, Ynetnews|work=ynet|date=4 August 2014}}</ref> The victim, a 25-year-old male, died after resuscitation attempts failed. The bus was empty at the time of the incident minimizing the casualties.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/construction-vehicle-slams-jerusalem-bus-suspected-attack-police-110812447.html|title=Jerusalem rocked by two suspected Palestinian attacks|date=4 August 2014|work=Yahoo News}}</ref> Israel later announced that the tractor driver's cousin's house was destroyed by the IDF two weeks ago, and this is believed to be a revenge attack.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/day-28-hamas-wants-egypt-to-press-israel-on-ceasefire-demands-hadar-goldin-laid-to-rest/#liveblog-entry-1042255|title=After day of terror in J'lem, rocket attacks, Israel and Hamas agree to 72-hour ceasefire - The Times of Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
At approximately 16:00 an IDF soldier was shot in the stomach just outside [[Mount Scopus]] at [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem|Hebrew University]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/National-News/Motorcycle-riders-open-fire-near-Hebrew-University-in-Jerusalem-seriously-wounding-1-person-370016|title=IDF soldier in serious condition after shots fired in Jerusalem's Mount Scopus tunnel|publisher=}}</ref> After the soldier was shot, the shooter jumped on his motorcycle heading toward the Arab village of [[Wadi al-Joz]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183711#.U9-YNGJdXDg|title=Soldier Shot in Jerusalem|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
In the late evening it was announced that once again both Hamas and Israel has agreed to a 72-hour ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2014/08/04/police-excavator-rams-israeli-bus-amid-gaza-war|title=Israel, Hamas accept Egyptian cease-fire plan - US News|work=US News & World Report}}</ref> Netanyahu has previously stated he wouldn't explore a ceasefire until the tunnels were all destroyed, which was finishing earlier on 4 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-hamas-agree-to-egypt-proposal-for-72-hour-truce/|title=Israel, Hamas agree to Egypt proposal for 72-hour truce|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
==Timeline, weeks 5–8==
===Week 5===
====5 August==== Shortly after midnight, hours before the ceasefire, Obama signed ''The Iron Dome Bill'' providing $225 million in additional funding for the Iron Dome.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/obama-approves-225-million-in-iron-dome-funding/|title=Obama approves $225 million in Iron Dome funding|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
In the early afternoon a security guard was stabbed at the entrance to [[Ma'ale Adumim]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.clickondetroit.com/news/israel-pulling-out-of-gaza-ahead-of-truce/27310898 |accessdate=5 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808050603/http://www.clickondetroit.com/news/israel-pulling-out-of-gaza-ahead-of-truce/27310898 |archivedate=8 August 2014 }}</ref> The security guard then opened fire on the stabber who was able to flee on foot toward Kfar Azaria.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/Flash.aspx/300794#.U-DWg2JdXDg|title=Stabbing Attack in Ma'ale Adumim, Police Combing Area - Latest News Briefs - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
As day 29 ended, both sides had thus far held their fire, and both sides has representation in Cairo to discuss a more permanent truce.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/08/humanitarian-ceasefire-begins-gaza-2014855316321399.html|title=Gaza ceasefire sets stage for Cairo talks|publisher=}}</ref>
====6 August==== After 30 hours of silence in southern Israel, false alarm sirens rang out along the Gaza border.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Rocket-sirens-heard-in-south-prove-to-be-false-alarms-as-tenuous-cease-fire-holds-370221|title=Rocket sirens heard in South prove to be false alarms as tenuous cease-fire holds|publisher=}}</ref>
In the evening Egypt proposed an extension of the cease fire from Friday morning until Sunday morning.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/egypt-proposes-cease-fire-extension-to-120-hours/2014/08/06/|title=The Jewish Press » » Egypt Proposes Cease Fire Extension to 120 Hours|author=Hana Levi Julian|work=The Jewish Press}}</ref> Israel later announced that they accepted the extension.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183795#.U-J4emJdXDgM|title=Report: Israel Accepts, Hamas Rejects Truce Ext. - Defense/Security - News - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> Hamas later responded by saying there was no agreement to extend the ceasefire and would renew fire if their demands were not met.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4555803,00.html|title=Israel agrees to extend current Gaza ceasefire; Hamas vows to renew fire|work=ynet|date=6 August 2014}}</ref>
====7 August==== As permanent ceasefire talk progresses, the main separation point holds with Hamas demanding the lifting of the blockade, with Israel demanding Hamas demilitarization.<ref>{{cite news |title= Israel Hamas dig in as Gaza talks go on in Cairo |url= http://www.seattlepi.com/news/world/article/Israel-Hamas-dig-in-as-Gaza-talks-go-on-in-Cairo-5673606.php |work=Seattle Post-Intelligencer |deadurl=yes |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20140807120848/http://www.seattlepi.com/news/world/article/Israel-Hamas-dig-in-as-Gaza-talks-go-on-in-Cairo-5673606.php |archivedate=7 August 2014 }}</ref> Israel has agreed that it will release the blockade and expand the Gaza fishing zone, on the condition that all the groups in Gaza demilitarize.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183814#.U-N2uGJdXDg|title=Report: Israel to Lift Travel Restrictions on Gaza - Middle East - News - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
In the evening it was announced that the body of [[Ayman Taha]], a Hamas official, was found in Shuja'iyya ruins.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4556224,00.html |date= 7 August 2014 |title= Report: Body of senior Hamas member Ayman Taha recovered from Saja'yya ruins}}</ref> It is believed that he was executed for spying for Egypt.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4556236,00.html |title=Palestinian officials: Hamas member Ayman Taha executed, accused of spying f... - Israel News, Ynetnews |work=ynet |date=7 August 2014}}</ref> Additionally Hamas admitted that a number of collaborators with Israel have been executed.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/253552/hamas-executes-palestinians-for-collaborated-with-israel.html |title= The Yeshiva World - Hamas Executes Palestinians for Collaborated With Israel {{!}} Frum Jewish News |publisher= |date=2014-08-07}}</ref>
An armed Palestinian man on a bus, who was in the country illegally, was arrested in [[Beit Shemesh]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/Flash.aspx/301027#.U-PJfmJdXDg|title=Bus Driver Spots Suspicious Passenger, Police Find Knife - Latest News Briefs - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
====8 August==== Amid the stalemate regarding the negotiations in Cairo, hours before the end of the 72-hour cease-fire, Israel announced fire from southern Gaza into Israel resumed, however Hamas denied it. At 04:02, rocket sirens sounded in southern Israel, and at 04:35, mortar rounds landed in southern Israel as well. No injuries were reported.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/mobile/1.609323?v=385276172EC036F7E4CF9DE6903CF905|title=LIVE UPDATES: Operation Protective Edge, day 31|publisher=|newspaper=Haaretz|date=2014-08-08}}</ref>
At 08:00, at the end of the ceasefire, rockets from Gaza were fired at Ashkelon, with one rocket downed by the Iron Dome.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/183850|title = Sirens Sound as Cease-Fire Breaks|last = Dvorin|first = Tova|date = 8 August 2014|work = Arutz Sheva|accessdate = 8 August 2014}}</ref> Within the first few hours after the ceasefire's end, over 35 rockets were fired from Gaza at Israel,<ref name="theguardian.com">{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/aug/08/israel-air-strikes-rockets-gaza-ceasefire-ends|title=Israel resumes air strikes after rockets fired from Gaza as ceasefire ends|author=Jason Burke|newspaper=the Guardian|date=2014-08-08}}</ref> resulting in two injuries.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Two-injured-in-Israel-by-Gaza-rocket-370494|title=Iron Dome intercepts two rockets over Beersheba; Three Israelis hurt in south|publisher=}}</ref>
After several hours of rocket fire, Netanyahu ordered Israel to respond and resume targeted strikes in Gaza.<ref name="theguardian.com" /> Israel announced that their troops were still positioned along the Gaza border, and are prepared for any necessary action.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/IDF-airstrikes-pound-Hamas-after-rocket-attacks-mark-end-of-truce-370488|title=Five Palestinians dead, at least 30 hurt as IAF strikes terrorist targets in Gaza|publisher=}}</ref>
The Israeli delegation left Cairo, stating they will not negotiate any long term ceasefire while under fire.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Israeli-delegation-leaves-Egypt-Gazans-flee-eastern-neighborhoods-again-370485|title = Israeli delegation leaves Egypt; Gazans flee eastern neighborhoods, again|last = Keinon|first = Herb|date = 8 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 12 August 2014|agency = Reuters}}</ref>
The IDF stated that since resuming fighting, over 57 rockets were fired from Gaza, and the IDF struck 51 targets in Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/08/08/us-mideast-gaza-idUSKBN0G70JY20140808|title = Israel strikes Gaza after militants resume rocket fire|last = al-Mughrabi|first = Nidal|date = 8 August 2014|work = Reuters|accessdate = 12 August 2014|last2 = Heller|first2 = Jeffrey}}</ref>
====9 August==== Senior Hamas official Moaaz Zaid was killed when an airstrike hit a mosque in Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.foxnews.com/world/2014/08/09/israel-conducts-more-strikes-on-targets-in-gaza-after-cease-fire-collapses/|title = Senior Hamas member reportedly killed in Gaza after fighting resumes|last = |first = |date = 9 August 2014|work = Fox News|accessdate = 10 August 2014}}</ref> Two other Hamas operatives were killed in an airstrike on the motorcycle they were riding in the [[Maghazi (camp)|Maghazi refugee camp]].<ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/airstrikes-resume-as-gaza-three-day-truce-ends/2014/08/09/a25cc4de-1f9e-11e4-ab7b-696c295ddfd1_story.html|title = Airstrikes, rocket launches continue after Gaza truce crumbles|last = Raghavan|first = Sudarsan|date = 9 August 2014|work = The Washington Post|accessdate = 10 August 2014|last2 = Booth|first2 = William}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/10-killed-in-gaza-over-weekend-as-fighting-rages-on/ | title=Ten killed in Gaza over weekend as fighting rages on}}</ref> The IDF claimed to have attacked 60 targets and killed nine militants in targeted killings. Two Hamas operatives were killed in fighting with the IDF in [[Al-Qarara]] when they emerged from a tunnel and attacked an Israeli tank.<ref name="estimate">https://www.terrorism-info.org.il/Data/articles/Art_20841/E_105_15_1379706052.pdf</ref>
Over 30 rockets were fired at Israel,<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://fox2now.com/2014/08/09/more-strikes-on-gaza-more-rockets-into-israel-as-blame-game-continues/|title = More strikes on Gaza, more rockets into Israel as blame-game continues|last = |first = |date = 9 August 2014|work = Fox2Now|accessdate = 10 August 2014|agency = CNN}}</ref> and 49 targets were struck in Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.ledger-enquirer.com/2014/08/09/3239543/rockets-airstrikes-after-gaza.html?sp=/99/164/252/ |title=Israel, Hamas war enters second month |last=Greenberg |first=Joel |date=9 August 2014 |work=Columbus Ledger Enquirer |accessdate=10 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140811200908/http://www.ledger-enquirer.com/2014/08/09/3239543/rockets-airstrikes-after-gaza.html?sp=%2F99%2F164%2F252%2F |archivedate=11 August 2014 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
====10 August==== After Israel has previously stated they will not negotiate while under rocket fire, Hamas and the PIJ stated they would leave Cairo on 10 August if Israel did not attend negotiations.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Palestinian-delegation-to-leave-Cairo-cease-fire-negotiations-370609|title = Palestinian delegation to leave Cairo cease-fire talks unless Israelis return|last = |first = |date = 10 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 10 August 2014}}</ref> Later it was announced that Israel and the Palestinian factions accepted a three-day ceasefire, beginning midnight.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.timesofisrael.com/egyptian-brokered-ceasefire-set-to-begin-at-midnight/|title = Egyptian-brokered ceasefire set to begin at midnight|last = |first = |date = 10 August 2014|work = The Times of Israel|accessdate = 10 August 2014|agency = AFP}}</ref>
In the afternoon, the [[Kerem Shalom border crossing]] was closed, due to rocket fire landing in the area, for the protection of the workers.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Israel-closes-Kerem-Shalom-crossing-due-to-rocket-fire-370660|title = Israel closes Kerem Shalom crossing due to rocket fire|last = |first = |date = 10 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref> Much of the food and aid that enters Gaza goes through this crossing, and were unable to be transferred during that time.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/253689/kerem-shalom-crossing-closed-due-to-rocket-fire.html|title = Kerem Shalom Crossing Closed Due to Rocket Fire|last = |first = |date = 10 August 2014|work = The Yeshiva World News|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref> Later, the IDF discovered and attacked six militants attempting to use the crossing to enter Israel, killing all of them.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.timesofisrael.com/day-34-anti-war-protesters-gather-in-tel-aviv-as-israel-hamas-conflict-presses-on/#liveblog-entry-1046202|title = After heavy rocket attacks on south, ceasefire takes effect|last = |first = |date = 10 August 2014|work = The Times of Israel|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref>
Turkey announced in the evening that they would utilize the 72 hour ceasefire to evacuate wounded Palestinians to their hospitals.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Erdogan-Turkey-to-evacuate-wounded-Palestinians-for-treatment-370699|title = Erdogan: Turkey to evacuate wounded Palestinians for treatment|last = |first = |date = 11 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 11 August 2014|agency = Reuters}}</ref>
Before midnight, as in the other ceasefire, both sides took final shots at each other. Israel successfully targeted Faraj Abu Raviah, who was active in the tunnel network of northern Gaza Strip, while in a tunnel in Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4557347,00.html|title = IDF killed militant in Hamas tunnel in north Gaza before ceasefire|last = Zitun|first = Yoav|date = 11 August 2014|work = Ynetnews|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Before-start-of-truce-IDF-kills-Hamas-terrorist-active-in-tunnel-networks-370705|title = Before start of truce, IDF kills Hamas terrorist active in tunnel networks|last = |first = |date = 11 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref> A series of rockets was fired from Gaza at various locations around Israel, including Eshkol,<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4557345,00.html|title = Five rockets exploded near Eshkol community few minutes before ceasefire|last = |first = |date = 11 August 2014|work = Ynetnews|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref> Ashdod, Gush Dan, and Tel Aviv.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/Rockets-fired-on-Israel-shortly-before-start-of-72-hour-truce-with-Hamas-370698|title = Rocket barrage on Israel shortly before start of 72 hour truce with Hamas|last = Keinon|first = Herb|date = 11 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 11 August 2014}}</ref>
====11 August==== In the morning, as the ceasefire appeared to hold, Egypt's foreign ministry announced that they opened the Rafah border crossing to allow aid into Gaza, although some Gaza residents claimed the crossing was still closed.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2014/08/11/foreign-ministry-denies-rafah-border-closure/ |title=Foreign ministry denies Rafah border closure |last=Abaza |first=Jihad |date=11 August 2014 |work=Daily News Egypt |accessdate=12 August 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140812210858/http://www.dailynewsegypt.com/2014/08/11/foreign-ministry-denies-rafah-border-closure/ |archivedate=12 August 2014 }}</ref> Hamas official Izzat al-Risheq, a member of the Hamas negotiating team in Cairo, announced that Hamas does not object to Fatah policemen manning the Rafah crossing.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Operation-Protective-Edge/In-first-Hamas-says-will-not-oppose-Palestinian-Authority-forces-at-Rafah-crossing-370774|title = Hamas: We’ll let the PA monitor Rafah crossing|last = Abu Toameh|first = Khaled|date = 11 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 12 August 2014|last2 = Keinon|first2 = Herb}}</ref>
In the afternoon, the UN announced a [[United Nations Fact Finding Mission on the 2014 Israel–Gaza conflict|fact finding mission]], whose members will be [[William Schabas]], [[Amal Clooney]] and [[Doudou Diène]]. Later, Clooney turned down the offer, due to other commitments.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/08/un-names-gaza-war-crimes-probe-panel-2014811231432316350.html|title = UN names Gaza war crimes probe panel|last = |first = |date = 12 August 2014|work = Al Jazeera English|accessdate = 13 August 2014|agency = Reuters}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url = https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/gaza/11027430/Amal-Alamuddin-turns-down-Gaza-investigation-role.html|title = Amal Alamuddin turns down Gaza investigation role|last = Ensor|first = Josie|date = 11 August 2014|work = The Telegraph|accessdate = 13 August 2014|location=London}}</ref> Israel claimed that the committee, and particularly the chairman Schabas, is biased against Israel, pointing to previous comments by Schabas, including calls for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to be tried before the International Criminal Court.<ref name="jpostSchabas">{{Cite news|url = http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Politics-And-Diplomacy/Head-of-UNHRCs-Gaza-probe-disputes-claims-hes-anti-Israeli-370850|title = UNHRC investigator Schabas stays mum on Hamas as ‘terror group’|last = Lazaroff|first = Tovah|date = 12 August 2014|work = The Jerusalem Post|accessdate = 13 August 2014}}</ref> Israel referred to the inquiry as a [[kangaroo court]].<ref name="jpostSchabas" /><ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.interaksyon.com/article/93141/un-panel-to-probe-gaza-war-crimes-but-israel-derides-kangaroo-court|title = UN panel to probe Gaza war crimes but Israel derides 'kangaroo court'|last = Nebehay|first = Stephanie|date = 12 August 2014|work = Interaksyon|accessdate = 13 August 2014|last2 = Reuters|deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140812203718/http://www.interaksyon.com/article/93141/un-panel-to-probe-gaza-war-crimes-but-israel-derides-kangaroo-court|archivedate = 12 August 2014|df = dmy-all}}</ref> Canadian Foreign Minister John Baird called the UN Human Rights Council a "sham" for appointing the committee, and said the committee is a "shame" and will do nothing to promote peace.<ref name="jpostSchabas" />
===Week 6===
====12 August==== The [[IHH (Turkish NGO)|Turkish Humanitarian Relief Foundation (IHH)]] announced a new attempt to breach the Israeli naval blockade of Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.newsweek.com/new-turkish-humanitarian-flotilla-set-defy-gaza-blockade-263825|title = New Turkish Humanitarian Flotilla Set to Defy Gaza Blockade|last = Sharkov|first = Damien|date = 11 August 2014|work = Newsweek|accessdate = 13 August 2014}}</ref>
As talks in Cairo continued, varying reports stated the progress were being made toward a long term ceasefire, although Israel still did not agree to building a seaport or an airport in Gaza.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/gaza-strip-crisis-israel-agree-ease-blockade-territory-reach-hamas-truce-1460787|title = Gaza Strip Crisis: Israel Agree to Ease Blockade of Territory to Reach Hamas Truce|last = Moore|first = Jack|date = 12 August 2014|work = International Business Times|accessdate = 13 August 2014}}</ref>
Hamas claimed that the Israeli Navy violated the ceasefire and fired at Gaza. Israel maintains that a fishing boat attempted to leave the permitted fishing zone, and that the Navy then fired warning shots at the boat.<ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/navy-fired-warning-shots-at-gaza-boat-nearing-prohibited-waters/2014/08/12/|title = Navy Fired Warning Shots at Gaza Boat Nearing Prohibited Waters|last = Ben-Gedalyahu|first = Tzvi|date = 12 August 2014|work = The Jewish Press|accessdate = 13 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url = http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=720052|title = Israeli warships open fire at fishermen near Rafah|last = |first = |date = 12 August 2014|work = Ma'an News Agency|accessdate = 13 August 2014}}</ref>
