====13 August==== During the night, the UK announced that if the fighting in Gaza continued after the ceasefire, they would suspend their military sales to Israel, while investigating whether they have been used properly.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/aug/12/british-arms-exports-israel-gaza-block-suspension|title=UK government to block arms exports to Israel if military action resumes|author=Rupert Neate|newspaper=the Guardian|date=2014-08-12}}</ref>
In the late morning, Al-Aqsa radio again reported that Israel was in violation of the ceasefire, by firing on Beit Lahiya.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/foreign/13-Aug-2014/italian-journo-three-bomb-disposal-experts-two-others-killed-in-gaza|title=Italian journalist among six killed in Gaza's Beit Lahiya town|work=Daily Times|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140814001453/http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/foreign/13-Aug-2014/italian-journo-three-bomb-disposal-experts-two-others-killed-in-gaza|archivedate=14 August 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Later reports from Gaza medical facilities corrected the earlier reports, stating 6 were killed in an attempt to disable Israeli missiles that had not exploded.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2014/aug/13/gaza-blast-israeli-missile-dead-journalist-associated-press|title=Gaza blast leaves several dead during attempt to disable Israeli missile|newspaper=the Guardian|date=2014-08-13|last1=France-Presse|first1=Agence}}</ref> [[Deaths of Simone Camilli and Ali Shehda Abu Afash|Two journalists were killed]] in Beit Lahiya along with three Hamas police engineers and three other people by an unexploded Israeli bomb that detonated as a police engineering team was working to neutralize it. The two journalists, who had been reporting on the efforts to defuse the bomb, were Simone Camilli, an [[Italy|Italian]] video journalist working for the [[Associated Press]], and Ali Shehda Abu Afash, a Palestinian journalist who had been working with Camilli.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/world/gaza-conflict-journalist-simone-camilli-among-6-killed-after-gaza-bomb-disposal-goes-wrong-1.2735053 | title=Journalist among 6 killed after Gaza bomb disposal goes wrong | CBC News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bnd.com/2014/08/13/3347722/ap-video-journalist-killed-in.html? |title=Metro-east news from Belleville, IL - Belleville News-Democrat |publisher= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140814224337/http://www.bnd.com/2014/08/13/3347722/ap-video-journalist-killed-in.html |archivedate=14 August 2014 }}</ref>
Hamas originally scheduled a press conference for 21:30,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/hamas-breaks-ceasefire-with-three-rocket-attacks/2014/08/13/|title=The Jewish Press » » Hamas Breaks Cease-Fire with Three Rocket Attacks|author=Tzvi Ben-Gedalyahu|work=The Jewish Press}}</ref> when they were expected to announce that the ceasefire talks failed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4558493,00.html|title=Hamas source: Negotiations have failed; Palestinian delegation will announce... - Israel News, Ynetnews|work=ynet|date=13 August 2014}}</ref> Israel however has agreed to extend the ceasefire an additional 72 hours.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=720455|title=Ceasefire falls apart in final hours with no renewal in sight|work=Maan News Agency}}</ref> At 21:45, few hours prior to the end of the ceasefire, sirens were heard in Ashkelon,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Breaking-News/Code-Red-sirens-sound-in-Ashkelon-Coast-region-371014|title=Code Red sirens sound in Ashkelon Coast region|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Rocket-sirens-sound-in-southern-Israel-hours-before-end-of-temporary-cease-fire-371015|title=Rocket fire targets southern Israel hours before temporary cease-fire deadline|publisher=}}</ref> in which the rocket landed in an open area.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4558501,00.html|title=Gaza rocket hits open area in Hof Ashkelon Regional Council|work=ynet|date=13 August 2014}}</ref> Israeli police later confirmed that an additional rocket from Gaza landed in Sha'ar HaNegev.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4558505,00.html|title=Police: Gaza rocket hits open area in Sha'ar HaNegev Regional Council|work=ynet|date=13 August 2014}}</ref> Hamas spokesman Sami Abu Zuhri denied any rocket fire.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://af.reuters.com/article/egyptNews/idAFL6N0QJ50020140813|title=Hamas spokesman denies any rockets fired from Gaza at Israel|publisher= | work=Reuters|date=13 August 2014}}</ref>
The Palestinian factions, shortly before the ceasefire expired, announced the extension of the ceasefire by five days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4558549,00.html|title=Palestinian envoy: Ceasefire extended by 5 days|work=ynet|date=13 August 2014}}</ref> Despite the ceasefire extension announcement, shortly before midnight the Iron Dome intercepted a rocket over Netivot, while two more landed in open areas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4558556,00.html|title=Irone Dome intercepts rocket over Netivot; 2 hit open area|work=ynet|date=14 August 2014}}</ref>
====14 August==== During the night, despite the ceasefire still in affect, Netanyahu ordered the IDF to retaliate for the rocket fire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/world/gaza-truce-extended-looks-fragile-1.1735028|title=Gaza truce extended, looks fragile|author=Independent Newspapers Online|work=Independent Online}}</ref> Israel struck four targets in Gaza, followed by two more rockets fired from Gaza into Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://arynews.tv/en/renewed-israel-palestinian-truce-off-to-shaky-start/|title=Gaza Massacre: Renewed Israel, Palestinian truce off to shaky start - ARY NEWS|work=ARY News|date=2014-08-14}}</ref>
The US confirmed that it has suspended the sale of [[AGM-114 Hellfire|Hellfire Missiles]] to Israel due to the current conflict.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israeli-official-confirms-us-nixed-missile-sale-pm-blamed-for-soured-ties/|title=Israeli official confirms US nixed arms shipment; pols argue over who's to blame - The Times of Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
====15 August==== PIJ officer Ziad al-Nakhaleh stated that even if a lasting agreement isn't achieved by Monday, the ceasefire will continue, in addition to confirming that the seaport and airport talks have been postponed.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Defense/Security-cabinet-convenes-to-discuss-cease-fire-amid-conflicting-reports-of-progress-made-371195|title=Islamic Jihad official: There will be a cease-fire, even without an agreement|publisher=}}</ref>
A report by [[al-Shorouk]] stated that the 11 terms of the ceasefire are:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.shorouknews.com/news/view.aspx?cdate=15082014&id=d62d271b-f6a5-43a1-9a50-125085c67fbe|title=الشروق» تنفرد بنشر 11 بندًا بلورتها مصر لتثبيت الهدنة بين إسرائيل وغزة - بوابة الشروق|publisher=}}</ref>
* Israel will halt military actions in Gaza by land, air or sea. * All Palestinian factions in Gaza will stop all attacks against Israel by land, air or sea. * The openings between Israel and Gaza for the transfer of goods to rebuild Gaza will be determined between Israel and the Palestinian Authority. * Israel and PA will coordinate all issues of funds related to Gaza's reconstruction. * The elimination of the buffer zones along the security fence, in stages, with the deployment of PA troops. * The fishing zone in stages will be extended to 12 miles, coordinated by Israel and the PA. * Israel will assist the PA in rebuilding infrastructure destroyed in Gaza as well as assisting those whose homes were destroyed. * International aid groups will provide the basic products needed to rebuild Gaza. * Egypt implores the international community to provide swift humanitarian and monetary assistance for Gaza's reconstruction. * The exchange of prisoners and remains will also be discussed at a later time. * The seaport and airport will be discussed at a later time
====16 August==== Palestinians in Cairo tell Israel to meet their demands or "face a long war."{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} Israeli officials stated that if talks in Cairo fail, it will be up to the UN Security Council to negotiate a truce.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.610872|title=Israeli officials: If Cairo talks fail, Western powers will seek Gaza truce via UN Security Council|date=17 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com|last1=Ravid|first1=Barak}}</ref>
====17 August==== Israel responded to Palestinian demands by saying that no demands will be met without security being guaranteed in Israel, including the demilitarization of Gaza.{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} As a sign of good faith, Israel removed the fishing blockade and allowed Gazan fishermen to fish up to the three miles out.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://english.pnn.ps/index.php/politics/7992-israel-announces-the-expansion-of-the-fishing-zone-in-gaza-as-a-goodwill-gesture |title=Israel announces the expansion of the fishing zone in Gaza as a 'goodwill gesture' |author=Amaia |publisher= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140818202502/http://english.pnn.ps/index.php/politics/7992-israel-announces-the-expansion-of-the-fishing-zone-in-gaza-as-a-goodwill-gesture |archivedate=18 August 2014 }}</ref>
====18 August==== In the evening, as the five-day ceasefire neared an end, Netanyahu stated that they are prepared for any scenario in Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.democracynow.org/2014/8/18/headlines/netanyahu_says_israel_prepared_to_renew_assault_as_ceasefire_deadline_looms|title=Netanyahu Says Israel Prepared to Renew Assault as Ceasefire Deadline Looms|work=Democracy Now!}}</ref> In preparation for possible restart of violence, the train to Sderot was canceled, so they could be fortified to protect against anti-tank missile attacks on them.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184144|title=Rockets Imminent? Train to Sderot Cancelled|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
Israel arrested 93 Hamas activists, who planned a third intifada and overthrowing the PA, according to Shin Bet.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560000,00.html|title=Abbas: Hamas plot against PA threatens unity govt|work=ynet|date=19 August 2014}}</ref>
Later in the evening, reports began circulating that Israel and the Palestinian factions have agreed to a long term ceasefire, which would be signed and announced at 23:00.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maannews.net/eng/ViewDetails.aspx?ID=721457|title=Ceasefire deal prepared in Cairo|work=Maan News Agency}}</ref> The Palestinians later confirmed they have accepted the ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560058,00.html|title=Palestinian envoy: Agreement reached for permanent ceasefire, waiting for Is... - Israel News, Ynetnews|work=ynet|date=18 August 2014}}</ref>
===Week 7===
====19 August==== Overnight news leaked that the US and Israel came to an agreement over the blockade of Gaza. Israel agreed to ease the blockade and in exchange, the US will use their international influence to prevent Hamas from rearming.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-us-secretly-agreed-on-gradual-easing-of-gaza-blockade/|title='Israel, US secretly agreed on gradual easing of Gaza blockade' - The Times of Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
In the afternoon, shortly before 16:00, three rockets fired from Gaza exploded outside of Be'er Sheva, breaking the ceasefire with the first action by either side in nearly 6 days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184196#.U_NNWWJdXDg|title=Three Rockets Fired at Be'er Sheva, IDF to Respond - Defense/Security - News - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> Shortly before the rocket fire, Hamas spokesman Fawzi Barhoum stated "If Netanyahu doesn’t understand … the language of politics in Cairo, we know how to make him understand," possibly hinting at the rocket fire,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.islandpacket.com/2014/08/19/3265132/israel-rockets-fired-from-gaza.html |title=Latest breaking news from Hilton Head & Beaufort, SC - The Island Packet |publisher= |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140820053644/http://www.islandpacket.com/2014/08/19/3265132/israel-rockets-fired-from-gaza.html |archivedate=20 August 2014 }}</ref> although Hamas denied involvement in the rocket fire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Hamas-Israel-is-escalating-the-situation-to-influence-Cairo-truce-talks-371522|title=Hamas: Israel is escalating the situation to influence Cairo truce talks|publisher=}}</ref> Netanyahu ordered the IDF to retaliate against the renewed fire,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/IDF-says-3-Gaza-rockets-land-in-Beersheba-despite-cease-fire-371496|title=IDF strikes in Gaza after 3 rockets fired at Beersheba despite cease-fire|publisher=}}</ref> and ordered the negotiators to return from Cairo due to the violations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theyeshivaworld.com/news/headlines-breaking-stories/254807/rocket-fire-towards-beersheva.html|title=The Yeshiva World Rocket Fire Towards Beersheva [UPDATED 16:39 IL] " " Frum Jewish News|publisher=|date=2014-08-19}}</ref>
At about 18:30 the Iron Dome intercepted two rockets over Netivot,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560430,00.html|title=Iron Dome downs 2 rockets over Netivot|work=ynet|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> its first interception in over a week. Later, two rockets were shot down over Sderot and another two over Be'er Sheva,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560586,00.html|title=Iron Dome downs 2 rockets over Sderot, 2 over Be'er Sheva|work=ynet|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> as well as several fired at Tel Aviv, which Hamas took credit for.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560576,00.html|title=Hamas: We fired M75, Fajr 5 rockets on central Israel|work=ynet|date=19 August 2014}}</ref>
Hamas announced that they blame Israel for the ending of the ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560507,00.html|title=Hamas: Netanyahu responsible for the collapse of peace talks|work=ynet|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> The US however has stated that they hold Hamas responsible for breaking the ceasefire and reiterated Israel's right to defend itself.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560504,00.html|title=US: Hamas broke ceasefire, Israel has right to defend itself|work=ynet|date=19 August 2014}}</ref> According to a senior Fatah official Qatar threatened Hamas' political bureau chief Khaled Mashal that it would expel him if Hamas accepts the Egyptian ceasefire deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560750,00.html|title=Report: Qatar threatened to expel Mashal|work=ynet|date=20 August 2014}}</ref>
Israel attempted to assassinate the chief commander of Hamas' military wing, [[Mohammad Deif]], in an airstrike on his house in the [[Sheikh Radwan]] district of Gaza City, killing his wife and two children.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/08/20/uk-mideast-gaza-idUKKBN0GI12R20140820|title=Gaza war rages on, Hamas says Israel tried to kill its military chief|publisher= | work=Reuters|date=20 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2014/Aug-21/267987-body-of-deifs-daughter-3-pulled-from-gaza-rubble.ashx#axzz3B22Iezk2|title=Body of Deif's daughter, 3, pulled from Gaza rubble|work=The Daily Star Newspaper - Lebanon}}</ref> Israeli intelligence concluded in April 2015 that Deif had survived the assassination attempt, the fifth Israeli attempt to assassinate him.<ref name="ToI29April">[http://www.timesofisrael.com/hamass-chief-of-staff-alive-and-active-israel-confirms/ 'Hamas’s chief of staff alive and active, Israel confirms,'] [[The Times of Israel]] 29 April 2015.</ref>
In total 50 rockets were fired from Gaza at Israel, and Israel struck 30 targets in Gaza, on 19 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184218#.U_Sa02JdXDg|title=IDF: 50 Rockets Were Fired on Tuesday|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
====20 August====
In the morning, reports leaked that Qatar threatened to expel Khaled Mashaal if Hamas accepted the Egyptian ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Report-Qatar-threatened-to-expel-Mashaal-if-Hamas-okayed-Egypt-proposed-truce-371622|title=Report: Qatar threatened to expel Mashaal if Hamas okayed Egypt-proposed truce|publisher=}}</ref>
Hamas threatened to fire additional rockets at Ben Gurion on 21 August as 06:00. Their warning stated that all airlines should cancel their flights.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184251#.U_XvA2JdXDg|title=Hamas Threatens Ben-Gurion Airport - Global Agenda - News - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
On 20 August from Gaza 168 rockets were fired at Israel, a record since the operation began,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4560729,00.html|title=Gaza rocket fire hits new heights: 168 launched in one day|work=Ynetnews|date=20 August 2014}}</ref> accounting for over 200 rockets since the conflict resumed. In response, Israel carried out 92 attacks into Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/gaza-truce-deadline-passes-without-renewal-211419938.html|title=Israel steps up air strikes as Gaza buries dead|date=20 August 2014|work=Yahoo News}}</ref>
====21 August==== In the morning the IDF killed three Hamas commanders in an airstrike:<ref>{{cite web|url=http://fox17online.com/2014/08/21/3-senior-hamas-military-leaders-killed-in-israeli-airstrike/|title=3 senior Hamas military leaders killed in Israeli airstrike|work=Fox17|date=2014-08-21}}</ref> *[[Raed al Atar]] - The commander of Hamas' Rafah company and member of its high military council; participated heavily in attacks against Israel, including the kidnapping of Gilad Shalit.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jewishpress.com/news/breaking-news/israel-kills-top-hamas-commander-raed-al-attar/2014/08/21/|title=The Jewish Press » » Israel Kills Top Hamas Commander Raed Al-Attar|author=Hana Levi Julian|work=The Jewish Press}}</ref> *Muhammad Abu Shamala - The head of its southern command, believed by Israel to have been involved in every attack from Rafah since 2001.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/killing-of-hamas-chiefs-will-spark-desperate-terror-attempts-against-israel/|title=Killing of Hamas chiefs will spark desperate attacks against Israel|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref> *Mohammed Barhoum - Commander of the southern sector All three were also heavy involved with the cross-border tunnels.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2014/08/21/hamas-says-three-top-commanders-killed-by-israeli-airstrike-in-gaza/|title=Hamas says three top commanders killed by Israeli airstrike in Gaza|work=Fox News | date=21 August 2014}}</ref> Attar and Abu Shamaleh were also believed to have been involved in the attack in which Hadar Goldin was killed and his body seized. Hamas said that Israel would not break their resistance, and would pay a heavy price for their crimes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/08/israel-vows-continue-bombing-gaza-201482154350149949.html|title=Israel kills three top Hamas commanders|author=Al Jazeera and agencies|publisher=}}</ref>
The IDF in the afternoon called up 10,000 reservists.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/IDF-mobilizing-10000-reservists-after-Israel-targets-senior-Hamas-commanders-371848|title=IDF mobilizing 10,000 reservists after Israel targets senior Hamas commanders|publisher=}}</ref> Hamas killed 3 Palestinians and seven were arrested.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4561996,00.html | title=Hamas executes 18 for 'collaboration' with Israel| date=22 August 2014}}</ref>
====22 August==== In the morning Hamas shot dead 11 Palestinians it suspected of being informants for Israel at an abandoned police station, and another seven near a mosque.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/world/2014/08/22/hamas-kills-11-suspected-informers-for-israel/|title=Hamas kills 18 suspected Israel informants|work=Fox News | date=22 August 2014}}</ref> Hamas warned that others would soon be killed.<ref name="bbc20140822" />
Shooting in the south continued. A Grad rocket fired from Gaza hit a synagogue in Ashdod, injuring three civilians<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.iba.org.il/bet/?entity=1035961&type=1|title=Reshet Bet :: שת ב - באשדוד פגעה רקטה בבית כנסת - 3 נפצעו קל|publisher=}}</ref> In the afternoon Grad rockets were fired toward Gush Dan. In Sha'ar Hanegev a 4 year old Israeli child was killed in a mortar attack on kibbutz [[Nahal Oz]]. The Israeli Prime Minister said that military operations would intensify in response. At least 130 rockets were reported to have been fired, of which some were intercepted; others caused some damage and injuries. A rocket attack on [[Gan Yavne]] fatally wounded an IDF soldier who was on home leave from his unit after having served in the war. He died of his injuries a week later. Five others were also injured in the attack, including the soldier's younger brother.<ref>http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/ForeignPolicy/Terrorism/Victims/Pages/Netanel-Maman.aspx</ref><ref name="bbc20140822">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-28900098|title=BBC:Gaza conflict: Israeli boy's death 'will intensify ops', 22 August 2014|work=BBC News | date=22 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4562008,00.html|title=1 critically wounded after rocket hits street in Ashdod area|work=ynet|date=22 August 2014}}</ref> The IDF initially carried out about 30 airstrikes in Gaza, killing seven people according to the Gaza Health Ministry. Later, an Israeli airstrike destroyed a building in Gaza. The Palestinians reported at least 12 dead and dozens wounded.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.news1.co.il/Archive/001-D-352977-00.html | title=News1 | 12 הרוגים בתקיפת מבנה מדרום לעזה}}</ref> It was reported that 20 militants were killed and 50 wounded in the attack.
====23 August==== In the early afternoon the IDF stated that more than 100 rockets and mortars were fired into Israel since midnight.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4562346,00.html|title=At least five rockets were fired from Syria at northern Golan Heights|work=ynet|date=24 August 2014}}</ref>
Hamas killed four more Palestinians for collaborating with Israel, saying that they had been tried based on evidence. An aid to Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas condemned the executions as "provocative," illegal, and without a fair trial. Amnesty International said "Hamas must also remember that the right to a fair trial before a competent court remains in force during times of armed conflict".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4562519,00.html|title=ynetnews: Hamas executes four more 'collaborators' in Jabaliya, 23 August 2014|work=ynet|date=23 August 2014}}</ref>
An apartment complex, known as Al Zafer Tower 4,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/08/24/world/middleeast/israeli-strike-destroys-apartment-tower-in-gaza.html?_r=0|title=Israeli Strike Destroys Apartment Tower in Gaza|work=[[The New York Times]]|accessdate=24 August 2014|first1=Isabel|last1=Kershner|first2=Fares|last2=Akram|date=23 August 2014}}</ref> collapsed after an Israeli strike which was preceded by [[roof knocking]]<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cnbc.com/id/101942760|title=Israel destroys 13-story building in Gaza air strike|work=[[Reuters]] via [[CNBC]]|accessdate=24 August 2014}}</ref> to warn the residents. According to the IDF, the building was used as one of the headquarters for Hamas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Latest-News-Wires/2014/0823/Israeli-missiles-collapse-Gaza-apartment-building-wounding-at-least-22|title=Israeli missiles collapse Gaza apartment building, wounding at least 22|author=Karin Laub and Peter Enav|date=23 August 2014|work=The Christian Science Monitor}}</ref>
An unnamed Israeli army intelligence officer said that Hamas had over 2,000 short-range rockets and many dozens of mid-range rockets left, less than 30% of those they had before the operation started.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.612036|title=LIVE UPDATES: Operation Protective Edge, day 47|date=23 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref>
====24 August====
Israel assassinated senior Hamas official Mohammed al-Ghoul, who was Hamas' payroll head, in an airstrike on his car in northern Gaza. He had just taken $13 million from a contact who had smuggled it into Gaza from the Sinai which was to be used to pay the salaries of Hamas fighters. The cash he had taken was destroyed, which severely impacted Hamas' ability to pay salaries.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Operation-Harpoon-How-the-Mossad-and-an-Israeli-NGO-destroyed-terrorist-money-networks-513622 | title=How did the Mossad and an Israeli NGO destroy terrorist money networks? - Israel News - Jerusalem Post}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2014/08/24/israel-airstrike-gaza-hamas/14523473/|title=Israeli airstrike levels 7-story building in Gaza|agency=Associated Press|date=24 August 2014|publisher=|work=USA Today}}</ref>
In the afternoon a mortar wounded three Israeli Arabs who worked as taxi drivers tasked with taking a group of Gazans from the crossing into Israel for medical care.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4562669,00.html|title=Three Israeli Arabs wounded by Gaza mortar attack|work=ynet|date=24 August 2014}}</ref> About 135 rockets and mortar shells were fired on 24 August; five fell in built-up areas, ten were intercepted, and the remainder exploded in Israeli territory.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.itar-tass.com/world/746470|title=TASS: World - Gaza radicals launch 135 missiles on Israel|work=TASS}}</ref>
Five rockets from south Lebanon were fired into northern Israel early in the morning, the Lebanese Army later located the launcher used.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Rockets-from-Syria-land-in-Golan-Heights-after-Lebanese-Katyusha-strikes-Israel-372043|title=Rockets from Syria land in Golan Heights after Lebanese Katyusha attack|publisher=}}</ref> The rockets caused an electrical power failure<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jerusalemonline.com/news/politics-and-military/military/rocket-fire-also-from-lebanon-and-syria-7580|title=Israel News - Rocket Fire Also from Lebanon and Syria - JerusalemOnline|author=Avraham|work=JerusalemOnline|date=2014-08-24}}</ref> and injuries in two kids.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Lebanon-News/2014/Aug-24/268283-army-finds-rocket-launching-pad-in-south-lebanon.ashx#axzz3BK1a81rU|title=Army finds rocket launch pads in south Lebanon|work=The Daily Star Newspaper - Lebanon}}</ref> Israel did not return fire but appealed to the [[United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon]] to investigate.<ref name="TOI24" />
Five rockets were fired from Syria into the Israeli-occupied [[Golan Heights]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/sy.html|title=CIA factbook. Syria, international disputes: "Golan Heights is Israeli-occupied"|publisher=}}</ref> The IDF later assessed that rocket fire was unintentional and was a stray rocket from the [[Syrian Civil War]].<ref name="TOI24">[http://www.timesofisrael.com/volley-of-mortars-from-syria-hits-golan-heights/]{{dead link|date=March 2016}}</ref>
The Israeli Prime Minister said "I call on the inhabitants of Gaza to vacate immediately every site from which Hamas is carrying out terrorist activity. Every one of these places is a target for us."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.612139|title=haaretz|date=25 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref>
====25 August==== In the early morning hours news began to leak of Abbas's new plan for an independent Palestinian state, which would be announced on 26 August.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/184363#.U_s-WGJdXDg|title=Abbas to Submit 'Surprising' Proposal to Kerry|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref> In the first stage of the plan, Abbas would request from the UN a deadline for Israeli withdrawal to the [[Green Line (Israel)|1967 borders]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=19655|title=Israel Hayom - Abbas seeks a deadline for Israeli withdrawal from West Bank|publisher=}}</ref> The response from the Israeli Prime Minister's office indicated that Israel would oppose a withdrawal<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.612288|title=Haaretz: live updates|date=25 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref>
Hamas, one day after Iran claimed it down an Israeli drone, claimed it as well had downed an Israeli drone over Gaza.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Hamas-claims-it-seizes-Israeli-reconnaissance-drone-in-Gaza-372243|title=Hamas claims it seizes Israeli reconnaissance drone in Gaza|publisher=}}</ref>
In the afternoon, according to an unnamed Palestinian source said to be familiar with the issue, the Palestinian factions would agree to a monthlong ceasefire proposed by Egypt in order to restart truce talks in Cairo. Egyptian mediators were awaiting Israeli approval before formally announcing the plan on Monday evening<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailysabah.com/mideast/2014/08/25/gaza-groups-agree-to-onemonth-ceasefire-proposal|title=Gaza groups agree to one-month ceasefire proposal - MidEast - Daily Sabah|work=dailysabah.com}}</ref>
Hamas POWs interrogated by the IDF revealed that Hamas does in fact use mosques in Gaza for military operations. They also revealed that their tunnels were strategically built near kindergartens and clinics.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.612455|title=Mosques used for military operations, say Hamas POWs|date=26 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com|last1=Cohen|first1=Gili}}</ref>
In the late evening, a rocket once again was fired from Lebanon into Israel, landing in the [[Upper Galilee]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Rocket-sirens-sound-in-central-Israel-372280|title=Rocket fire strikes North again, Gaza belt under continued mortar barrage|publisher=}}</ref> The IDF returned fire toward the source of the rocket launch.<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.timesofisrael.com/israel-returns-fire-after-rockets-shot-at-galilee-from-lebanon/|title = Israel returns fire after rockets shot at Galilee from Lebanon|date = 25 August 2014|accessdate = 25 August 2014|website = Israel returns fire after rockets shot at Galilee from Lebanon|publisher = Times of Israel|last = |first = }}</ref>
More than 120 rockets and mortars have been fired from the Gaza Strip.<ref name="ReferenceA">{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.612468|title=LIVE UPDATES: Operation Protective Edge, day 50|date=27 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref>
===Week 8===
====26 August====
Gazan sources reported that overnight Israel struck a 13-story building in Gaza known as the Italian Tower, after firing three warning shots into the building, which contained a mix of residences, offices (including the Ministry of Public Works), and retail stores. Two were reported killed, about 20 injured, and most of the complex was destroyed.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2014/08/gaza-high-rise-hit-israeli-rockets-2014825213929205207.html|title=Gaza high-rise hit by Israeli strikes|work=[[Al Jazeera]]|accessdate=25 August 2014}}</ref> Hamas fired at sick Gazans as they tried to leave the Strip for treatment<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564025,00.html|title=Hamas 'fires at sick Gazans trying to leave for medical treatment|work=ynet|date=1 September 2014}}</ref> Three Salafist militants in Rafah were killed in an Israeli airstrike as they fired rockets at Israel.<ref name="estimate" />
The head of the Palestinian delegation to the Cairo cease-fire talks, said that difference of opinion among different Palestinian groups was delaying an agreement.<ref>[http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.612541Fatah official: Haaretz:'Hidden hands' stopped signing of Cairo accord, 26 August 2014]{{dead link|date=March 2016}}</ref> Hamas stated that the wording in the new Egyptian ceasefire proposal was acceptable to them,<ref>{{cite web|url = http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Senior-Hamas-leader-Language-of-Egyptian-ceasefire-proposal-acceptable-372346|title = Hamas official: Language of Egyptian cease-fire proposal 'acceptable'|date = 26 August 2014|accessdate = 26 August 2014|website = |publisher = Jerusalem Post|last = |first = }}</ref> stating "we’re prepared to discuss at a later stage the various controversial issues: the sea port, the prisoners and the airport, what’s important at this stage is ending the Israeli aggression, opening the crossings and rebuilding the Strip."<ref name="JA">{{cite web|url = http://www.timesofisrael.com/top-us-general-in-israel-for-post-ceasefire-talks/|title = Top US general in Israel for post-ceasefire talks|date = 26 August 2014|accessdate = 26 August 2014|website = |publisher = Times of Israel|last = |first = }}</ref> In hopes to restart future peace talks, the US sent [[United States Marine Corps|Marine Corps]] general [[John R. Allen|John Allen]] to Israel as a negotiator.<ref name="JA" />
During the day rockets hit a house<ref name="ynetnews.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564195,00.html|title='Our lives are a gift,' says woman whose house was hit with rocket|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> and kindergarten playground.<ref name="ReferenceB">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4563939,00.html|title=Rocket hits kindergarten playground, no one hurt|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> Two Israeli civilians were killed and four were injured in a mortar attack on kibbutz [[Nirim]].<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/1-killed-5-hurt-in-mortar-strike-on-southern-kibbutz/ | title=2 killed, 4 hurt in mortar strike on southern kibbutz}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564574,00.html|title=Israelis killed by mortar before ceasefire named|work=ynet|date=27 August 2014}}</ref><ref name="ReferenceC">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564339,00.html|title=Two killed, one wounded by Gaza mortar fire on Eshkol|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> A border crossing used by Gazans seeking medical treatment in Israel, among others, was under frequent rocket fire.<ref>[http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564025,00.html Ynet News:'Hamas fires at ill Gazans as they try to leave Strip for treatment', 26 August 2014]. Report of a visit, date of visit not spcified</ref> Power lines were damaged in the Eshkol Region.<ref name="israelnationalnews.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/Flash.aspx/302762#.U_y51Pl_ufY|title=8 Rockets Explode in Eshkol Region, Power Lines Damaged - Latest News Briefs - Arutz Sheva|work=Arutz Sheva}}</ref>
Hamas, and Islamic Jihad accepted an Egyptian ceasefire draft at 19:00 for a month.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4563989,00.html|title=Report: Hamas, Islamic Jihad accept Egyptian ceasefire draft|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> Hamas claimed it was accepted by both sides, and that they were waiting for a Cairo to determine the zero hour for implementation. Israel approves the ceasefire.<ref name="ReferenceA" /> The ceasefire was infringed.<ref name="jpost2" /><ref name="ReferenceA" /><ref name="ynet">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564287,00.html|title='Open-ended' Israel-Hamas ceasefire takes hold|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> Egypt agreed to open the Israel–Gaza barrier.
It was reported that the cease-fire accepted by Netanyahu without cabinet voted,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.612623|title=Israel, Hamas agree to unlimited Gaza cease-fire|date=26 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com|last1=Ravid|first1=Barak|last2=Lis|first2=Jonathan}}</ref> therefore Bennett calls for vote on Gaza ceasefire.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564465,00.html|title=Bennett calls for vote on Gaza ceasefire, says cabinet opposes deal|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=19697|title=Israel Hayom - Cease-fire deal not brought for Diplomatic-Security Cabinet vote|publisher=}}</ref>
In Gaza Hamas said in a news conference that they declared victory, and television showed Palestinians celebrating in the streets, with some waving the Hamas flag and others waving the Palestinian Authority flag.<ref name="npr20140826">{{cite web|url=http://www.wbur.org/npr/343401929/reports-hamas-says-it-has-reached-ceasefire-deal-with-israel|title=NPR: Hamas, Israel Reach Long-Term Cease-Fire Deal, 26 August 2014|work=WBUR}}</ref> The truce came into effect at 19:00 on 26 August; in the previous day over 182 rockets and mortar bombs were fired at Israel, 143 of them falling in open areas and five in residential areas, while 27 were intercepted. Since the collapse of a ceasefire the week before, over 1,045 rockets and mortars were fired at Israel, 141 of which were intercepted.<ref name="ynn20140827">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564561,00.html|title=Ynet News,Quiet night in southern Israel as Gaza ceasefire holds, 27 August 2014|work=ynet|date=27 August 2014}}</ref>
==Status==
{{As of|2014|8|26}}, when a month-long ceasefire was agreed, nearly 2,000 people had been killed in Gaza,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564444,00.html|title=Gaza residents celebrate Hamas 'victory' over Israel|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> and 69 Israelis.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564456,00.html|title=Gaza truce deal: Crossings to open under Israeli supervision|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> It was estimated that reconstruction in the Gaza Strip after damage suffered in this conflict would take 10 years.<ref name="ynn20140826" /> After Hamas had declared victory,<ref name="npr20140826" /> Israeli sources said that the IDF had struck 5,200 "terror targets" in Gaza and killed 1,000 "terrorists", that Hamas had received "the worst blow in its history",<ref name="ynn20140826">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564456,00.html|title=Ynet News:Gaza truce deal: Crossings to open under Israeli supervision, 26 August 2014|work=ynet|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> and that over 4,500 rockets had been fired into Israel.<ref name="ynn20140827" /> The UN estimated that at least 100,000 Gazans had been internally displaced following Operation Protective Edge.<ref name="ynn20140826" /> Ceasefires for a few hours or days had been agreed previously, but were either broken, or fighting continued after their expiry.
==Political status==
===Israel=== After the first comments of Netanyahu on August,<ref name="ynetnews1">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564922,00.html|title=Netanyahu: Hamas was 'hit hard,' won few concessions in ceasefire|work=ynet|date=27 August 2014}}</ref> opinions differ. Hamas wants to persuade the Gazans that it has won a victory, but others wonder if the costs of the battle were worth it.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.612655|title=Hamas trying to sell 'victory' to Gazans|date=27 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com|last1=Hass|first1=Amira}}</ref>
The cost of the war was economically and socially expensive as the Governor Karnit Flug states that she agrees with an increase the budget deficit for 2015 from 2.5% to 3% provided it stems from one-time requirements for covering the costs of Operation Protective Edge and its results.<ref>[http://www.globes.co.il/en/article-flug-lends-support-to-raising-deficit-1000967175 Globes English - Karnit Flug lends support to raising deficit<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Some will said that the war started after Israel opposed to the unity government of Palestinian Authority with Fatah and Hamas and as result, the negotiations plunged into crisis.<ref name="ynetnews2">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4512399,00.html|title=Instead of making peace with Israel, Abbas making peace with Hamas|work=ynet|date=23 April 2014}}</ref> Supposedly, those actions gave a validated to Hamas to kidnapping and kill the three teenage boys, which end, in fact, with an agreement with Hamas about casefire.
Other said that Hamas is a terrorist argumentation that uses the suffer and the pain in Gaza for his own purpose. Netanyahu by himself told, all ready, that Hamas is adamantly opposed to negotiations with Israel,<ref name="ynetnews2" /> and that the reason why so soon, after the sign deal, they were shooting from Gaza towards Israel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4512606,00.html|title=Netanyahu: Abbas chose Hamas over peace with Israel|work=ynet|date=23 April 2014}}</ref> Even after the fighting ends Hamas warned that this was only an interlude in Hamas' fight against Israel.<ref name="ynet" /> Therefore, the agreement with Hamas let for nothing, not only Israel had loss money and lives, she also get nothing because Hamas still control in Gaza and become even stronger in Gaza. The head of the Central Committee of Netanyahu's Likud party told "We promised the voters we would be decisive against Hamas, but when we had the chance we hesitated. It’s only a matter of time until we will have to face Hamas again."<ref name="ynetnews3">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4565042,00.html|title=Prime minister's support plummets as fighting ends|work=ynet|date=28 August 2014}}</ref> The fact that Netanyahu didn’t call the cabinet for a vote show that he was afraid of the opposition.<ref name="ynetnews3" />
Netanyahu's right flank in the government has been sharpening its knives even before the fighting with Hamas began and by the middle of the fighting, Minister Avigdor Lieberman reported to the media that Likud Yisrael Beiteinu dismantles partnership with Likud-Beiteinu.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/national/1.603492|title=Lieberman ends partnership with Netanyahu, dismantles Likud-Beiteinu|date=7 July 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref> Liberman reported that "Israel can't ensure safety of citizens in the South as long as Hamas rules Gaza", in additional he said, "It is impossible and forbidden to trust lowly murderers. Therefore, we are against a cease-fire that allows Hamas to rearm and wage another battle against Israel whenever it finds it comfortable...A real peace process and a strategic breakthrough will only be possible after we succeed in freeing the Middle East and the Palestinians from the threat of Hamas (and no one else will do so in our place)"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Liberman-Israel-cant-ensure-the-safety-of-its-citizens-in-the-South-as-long-as-Hamas-rules-Gaza-372499|title=Liberman: Israel can't ensure safety of citizens in the South as long as Hamas rules Gaza|publisher=}}</ref> Others have sniped at Netanyahu for his handling of the crucial US-Israel relationship, "He shouldn’t have gone into a direct confrontation with the Americans," Israeli Knesset member David Tzur.<ref name="ynetnews3" />
In response, on 27 August, Netanyahu, in his first comments, told that Hamas was hit hard and won few concessions.<ref name="ynetnews1" /> He also said that the goal of the opening [[Operation Protective Edge]] was not brings down Hamas but a long-term calm and inflicting substantial damage to "terrorist infrastructure".<ref name="israelhayom.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.israelhayom.com/site/newsletter_article.php?id=19699|title=Israel Hayom - Gaza cease-fire: 'Israel's goals met, Hamas achieved nothing' <img src="http://www.israelhayom.co.il/site/upload/photos/video_icon/video_icon_24.png" style="width:15px; height:15px;" />|publisher=}}</ref> Israeli officials emphasized that there were no direct talks with Hamas because the Palestinian delegation was headed by a Palestinian Authority official. Israel already open the border crossings reopen. In addition Israel prevent many attacks.<ref name="israelhayom.com" /> A source close to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said "not an arrangement; it is a cease-fire…a comprehensive deal will be possible only after the two sides discuss the various demands in a month's time."<ref name="israelhayom.com" /> On 28 August, at the Morning Show, "Keshet - Morning" it was reported that Israel also respected the requests of the Arab countries which worried to citizens of Gaza.
Skeptical citizens in the South said that they lost there trust in the Government.<ref name="jpost4">{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Israel-News/Southern-regional-council-heads-skeptical-of-cease-fire-372467|title=Leaders in southern Israel skeptical of Gaza cease-fire|publisher=}}</ref> Many believe that the goods planned to enter Gaza under international supervision<ref name="israelhayom.com" /> will fall into the hands of Hamas. Eshkol Regional Council Mayor: "We'll see what happens in the coming days, I don't think the cease-fire will last,"<ref name="jpost4" /> Although Netanyahu standing that Israel would not accept any further rocket fire, and if the attacks resumed, Israel would react with even more force.<ref name="ynetnews1" />
On 1 September, it was reported by BBC that Israel intended to "[[Gva'ot#2014 land reclassification|expropriate 4 sq km]] (1.5 sq miles) of Palestinian land in the occupied West Bank". The [[Israeli Civil Administration|military-run local administration]] said it was a response to the kidnapping and killing of three Jewish teenagers in the area in June.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-29008045|title=BBC News - Israel to take over West Bank land|newspaper=BBC News|date=September 2014}}</ref>
On 7 July, political source warns Hamas rebuilding Gaza warfare tunnels despite the ceasefire. Lieberman response that he does not believe it is possible to demilitarize Gaza. Meantime, Mahmoud al-Zahar continues to threaten, "If the Palestinian resistance in the West Bank held a quarter of the tools at the disposal of the resistance in Gaza – Israel would be demolished in a day."<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4568482,00.html|title=Senior source: Hamas rebuilding Gaza terror tunnels|work=ynet|date=7 September 2014}}</ref>
===Gaza and PA=== The celebration took hold for two days. Two men were killed during the celebration. Abu Obeida, a spokesman for the Hamas military wing, stood over an Israeli flag as he addressed the crowd. "Gaza achieved victory because it has done what major armies failed to do. It forced the enemy to retreat," he said. "We must know that no voice is louder than the voice of the resistance." ,<ref name="ynetnews1" /> "We are here today to declare the victory of the resistance, the victory of Gaza, with the help of God, and the steadfastness of our people and the noble resistance," Hamas spokesman Sami Abu said in a news conference at Gaza's Shifa Hospital.<ref name="ynet" /> Zuhri also said that their main goal is to liberating Jerusalem.<ref name="ynet" />
Abbas associates said that the PA would take legal action against Israel in The Hague, home to the International Criminal Court and the International Court of Justice.<ref name="israelhayom.com" /> on 1 September,
It appears that the unity government of Hamas Fatah is in crisis. There were allegations that Hamas abused Fatah members during Gaza war. They harassed, beaten and in some cases even killed Fatah members. Fatha soucre said, "they are just closed minded, unethical racist people who discriminate against non-Hamas people"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4566940,00.html|title=Hamas accused of abusing Fatah members during Gaza war|work=ynet|date=2 September 2014}}</ref> In addition, on 1 September, Abbas told that Mashaal is a lair because Hamas worked to bring down the PA ever since its establishment.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Middle-East/Abbas-Hamas-leader-Mashaal-is-a-liar-374113|title=PA chief Abbas: Hamas leader Mashaal is a liar|publisher=}}</ref> As mentioned, on 18 August Israel arrested 93 Hamas men, which tried to carry out a coup of the Palestinian Authority.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/1.611175|title=Israel arrested 93 Hamas men in West Bank over terror network targeting PA, Israel|date=18 August 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref>
Abbas was quoted as saying, "Hamas’s goal is to destroy the West Bank and create chaos in order to stage a coup against us. Hamas wants to drive me crazy. Since the kidnapping of [IDF soldier] Gilad Schalit they have been contacting the Americans and Israelis and Europeans and others. They have been doing things behind our backs." He also point out about the murder of the three youths, "When I asked Mashaal [about the murder of the three youths] he replied: ‘I don’t know.’ Then he told me, ‘I neither deny nor confirm.’ Lies and beating around the bush." Abbas pointed out that Saleh Arouri, later confirmed that his movement had been behind the murder of the youths.Mashaal enied the claim. After [[Operation Protective Edge]], support for Hamas rises, 61 percent of Palestinians say they would vote for Hamas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4566784,00.html|title=Poll finds support for Hamas rises after Gaza war|work=ynet|date=2 September 2014}}</ref>
On 6 September,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/1.614481|title=Abbas in sharp message to Hamas: Shape up or Palestinian unity government will fail|date=7 September 2014|work=Haaretz.com}}</ref> there were made first hints for the ending of the unity government. Abbas called in the media that "We won't accept the continuation of the situation with Hamas as it is now and in this shape. There must be one authority and one regime." He also reported that Hamas killed 120 men who defied because the house arrest imposed on them.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Arab-Israeli-Conflict/Abbas-hints-PA-close-to-ending-unity-deal-with-Hamas-374626|title=Abbas hints PA close to ending unity agreement with Hamas|publisher=}}</ref> Meanwhile, U.S. opposed for Abbas’ diplomatic plan since it is a unilateral Palestinians say,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/diplomacy-defense/.premium-1.614454|title=U.S. raps Abbas' diplomatic plan as 'unilateral,' Palestinians say|date=6 September 2014|work=Haaretz.com|last1=Khoury|first1=Jack|last2=Ravid|first2=Barak}}</ref> Herzog asked Abbas to avoid unilateral moves at the United Nations "that might hamper the chances for an agreement." Herzog added that he supports "real negotiations based on security and the fixing of borders as a first step." Despite this Abbas would be expected to bring the plan for a vote in the [[United Nations General Assembly]] but in any case, the General Assembly resolutions are not binding.
On 7 September, during the speech at Arab League, Abbas interrupted after he mention the revolution made by Hamas in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://new.elfagr.org/Detail.aspx?nwsId=686239|title=ääÔÑ äÕ ßáãÉ "ÔßÑí" ÃãÇã ÌÇãÚÉ ÇáÏæá ÇáÚÑÈíÉ ÈÚÏ ÞØÚ ßáãÉ "ÃÈæãÇÒä"|publisher=}}</ref><ref>News [[Channel 10 (Israel)|channel 10]], 8 July 2014</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jpost.com/Middle-East/Abbas-speech-at-Arab-League-interrupted-journalists-asked-to-leave-374667|title=Abbas speech at Arab League interrupted, journalists asked to leave|publisher=}}</ref> It reported that the session was planned to be closed to media. Hamas officials responded to Abbas's allegations by urging him to stop "inciting" against them. The Palestinian Ma’an News Agency reported today that in a speech given to Fatah Party on Sunday, Abbas said that the Egyptian government offer to the PA 618-square mile area of the Sinai adjacent to Gaza. Abbas rejected the offer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/abbas-rejects-egyptian-offer-to-settle-refugees-in-sinai/|title=Abbas rejects Egyptian offer to settle refugees in Sinai|work=The Times of Israel}}</ref>
===Arab countries=== Qatari media which knows that [[Foreign relations of Qatar|Qatar's support of Hamas]] calling Hamas' efforts a victory.<ref name="ynetnews4">{{cite web|url=http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-4564980,00.html|title=Arab media reports on Gaza Ceasefire|work=ynet|date=28 August 2014}}</ref>
On Al-Akhbar, Lebanese media, reported as the end of the firecaese that "Israel in shock: Intelligence failure in handling the rockets", and other media say that Israel had caved to Hamas' demands.<ref name="ynetnews4" />
Egypt which has a strong opponent of the Muslim Brotherhood condemns Israeli action in Gaza but thoughts that the actions of Hamas lead for nothing, only to more pain and suffering of the citizens's Gaza, while "The Hamas movement continues listening to voices from Qatar and Khaled Mashal who stays there and enjoys his time at the gym of one of the most luxurious hotels in Qatar"<ref name="ynetnews4" />
===USA=== U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry said Tuesday that the United States welcomed the newly announced cease-fire. "We strongly support today's cease-fire agreement, and call on all parties to fully and completely comply with its terms. ... We are all aware that this is an opportunity, not a certainty."<ref>{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2014/08/26/uk-mideast-gaza-idUKKBN0GP0X820140826|title=Gaza ceasefire takes hold as focus turns to longer term|publisher= | work=Reuters|date=26 August 2014}}</ref>
